2) then, if they think the sentence is true, they try to take the discs indicated by the True arrow (for example Red). Otherwise, if they think the sentence is false, they try to take the discs indicated by the False arrow (for example Blue). Because the discs of one colour aren't enough, they have to take them fast.
Who guessed the right disc, can keep it.
The player who first has 5 discs win.

Extended version: the players have to make all the actions written on the discs they won during the previous rounds.

166319.description: In Pixel Lincoln: The Deckbuilding Game – Expansion 2-3 – Election Day, Pixel Lincoln is up for re-election and along with that comes a new style of character. These will provide you votes, which can lead to big points. Snag the swing vote card to break ties. This expansion also comes with Secret Item: Vote cards and a brand new Item Card designed by the people.
166319.name: Pixel Lincoln: The Deckbuilding Game – Expansion 2-3: Election Day

166320.description:
4 new tiles are added to the game. These are special tiles with a canopy walk in only one of the two colours.

Giveaway at SPIEL 2014.
166320.name: Canopy Walk: Goodie Set I

166321.description:
Two new tiles for Canopy Walk. These tiles have a canopy walk in a single colour.

BoardGameGeek Store 2014
166321.name: Canopy Walk: Goodie Set II

166322.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Beware the mountain clans in The Valemen, the third Chapter Pack in the "Wardens" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game! This Chapter Pack continues the major themes of the "Wardens" cycle by giving more support to your "limited responses", trait-based decks, and the game's most expensive and recognizable characters. Within The Valemen, you'll find new versions of such iconic characters from A Song of Ice and Fire as Euron Crow's Eye, Ser Ilyn Payne, and Nymeria Sand.
166322.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – The Valemen
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire

166323.name: The Tomb of the Rainbow Sorcerer
166323.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is said that the Rainbow Sorcerer developed a new kind of magic based on colors. His sepulcher is said to contain a magical artifact that can bestow the power of the color magic to anyone owning it.

Grab a dungeon, add your favorite RPG system and go!

Each 0one's Page Dungeon features one dungeon, map and description, contained in one single page. The description is a complete adventure you can play as is (adding statblocks) or expand as you wish. Of course, being the whole adventure contained in half a page can’t be exhaustive, so only main guidelines are given.

These dungeons make perfect side treks as they are, and can become fully fleshed-out adventures with a little bit of work.

For each dungeon you get a color page, a print-friendly page, and a page containing only the dungeon with a blank space for your notes should you want build a new adventure from scratch.

The dungeon description contains usually keyed locations plus three additional paragraphs, helping you to insert the adventure in your own campaign.

166324.name: The Lair of the Rat-King
166324.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is said that a human-sized rat dwells in a hidden section of the city sewers. This monster can control rats and usually kidnaps people emerging from the sewers during the night. In the city someone tells the PCsthat the daughter of a noble family has been recently kidnapped.

Grab a dungeon, add your favorite RPG system and go!

Each 0one's Page Dungeon features one dungeon, map and description, contained in one single page. The description is a complete adventure you can play as is (adding statblocks) or expand as you wish. Of course, being the whole adventure contained in half a page can’t be exhaustive, so only main guidelines are given.

These dungeons make perfect side treks as they are, and can become fully fleshed-out adventures with a little bit of work.

For each dungeon you get a color page, a print-friendly page, and a page containing only the dungeon with a blank space for your notes should you want build a new adventure from scratch.

The dungeon description contains usually keyed locations plus three additional paragraphs, helping you to insert the adventure in your own campaign.

166325.name: The Dragon in the Well
166325.description:
From publisher blurb:

Local villagers usually brings cattle offerings to the ancient well just outside the village. A dragon is said to inhabit the well. Feeding the dragon ensures that he will not raid the countryside. Lately the dragon in the well has become more demanding, requesting gold and treasure too. Investigation is mandatory now.

Grab a dungeon, add your favorite RPG system and go!

Each 0one's Page Dungeon features one dungeon, map and description, contained in one single page. The description is a complete adventure you can play as is (adding statblocks) or expand as you wish. Of course, being the whole adventure contained in half a page can’t be exhaustive, so only main guidelines are given.

These dungeons make perfect side treks as they are, and can become fully fleshed-out adventures with a little bit of work.

For each dungeon you get a color page, a print-friendly page, and a page containing only the dungeon with a blank space for your notes should you want build a new adventure from scratch.

The dungeon description contains usually keyed locations plus three additional paragraphs, helping you to insert the adventure in your own campaign.

166326.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – A Time for Wolves
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire
166326.description:
Description from the publisher:

A Time for Wolves is the fourth Chapter Pack in the "Wardens" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. As the realm's most ambitious lords and ladies try to win the strength of the Vale to their cause, A Time for Wolves introduces sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty different cards) that ensure House Arryn and the Vale will make their mark. Among the Chapter Pack's twelve unique characters and locations, no fewer than five characters bear the House Arryn trait, including such notable figures as Petyr Baelish, Alayne Stone, and Lysa Arryn.

166327.name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Evasive Maneuvers
boardgamefamily: Star Wars: The Card Game LCG
166327.description:
Description from the publisher:

Evasive Maneuvers is the third Force Pack in the "Rogue Squadron" cycle for Star Wars: The Card Game. Its ten new objective sets (two copies each of five unique objectives) reinforce the cycle's main themes as new pilots arrive to fly your starships to victory. Meanwhile, as the Rebellion sends new capital ships to battle, you might interrogate prisoners with the Sith, or you might hire a deadly assassin in a dusty cantina on Tatooine. Call up your ace pilots, launch your starfighters, and dodge enemy fire with Evasive Maneuvers!

166328.name: Family Bingo
166328.description:
The party game Family Bingo requires dexterity, good memory, perceptiveness, and some basic knowledge. Players compete in eight different categories of activities, and the game includes 165 double-sided cards that tell players what to do.

A very important component of the game are 96 colorful wooden sticks in six colors; the game also includes 96 small number tokens and 16 big tokens. At the beginning of the game, each player receives a nice covering stand and personal bingo board. Players try to score a point by completing the task on the drawn card. The first player to do so covers a field on her bingo board with the number drawn at the beginning of the round. The tasks are very different, e.g., building a construction on time or after memorizing it, answering questions, guessing what another player is trying to visualize, guessing the color or number of sticks, throwing, stacking, and many, many more. Whoever creates a bingo first wins!

166329.description: The single card 7 Wonders: Leaders – Nimrod expansion needs both the 7 Wonders: Leaders and 7 Wonders: Babel expansions — as well as the 7 Wonders base game — in order to be used. Nimrod allows a player to earn money and bonus victory points when adding sections to the Babel wonder.
166329.name: 7 Wonders: Leaders – Nimrod

166330.description:
Ca$h 'n Guns (second edition): The Blackmailer is a new character card for use with the Ca$h 'n Guns (second edition) base game.

Special ability: At the the end of each turn, if the Godfather has more Loot share cards than you, he must give you one.
166330.name: Ca$h 'n Guns (Second Edition): The Blackmailer

166331.name: Cyntopia: The future is now
166331.description:
Cyntopia: The future is nowis a cooperative, fast-paced and action packed tabletop boardgame which takes places in a dystopic future. You'll fight huge corporations as an Edgewalker and make your living while flirting with the line. Will you fight or fall?

Cyntopia: The future is now is now takes place in a completely new cyberpunk universe. It features a cooperative gamemode for 1-7 players, a modular boardgame, over 30 miniatures and a random mission system.

The goal of the game is to fulfill your mission as Edgewalker, the mission and corporation you work against will be drawn by cards and decide the first floortile of the boardgame.

During the Edgewalk you have to fight against the guards of the corporation in a simple, yet luck and strategy based fighting system. The success of each interaction depends on the dice roll.

166332.name: Evening Session Map Set #06
166332.description:
From publisher blurb:

Evening Session Map #06 consists of maps and handouts of The Barakesh barrow

The set consists of:

a realm map (sketch made by a local townsfolk);
a location map (map of a barrow site);
a one barrow drawing;
maps of two level dungeon

166333.description:
Four players compete in the card game Primiera to score as many points as possible, with the partnerships between players changing each round depending on who plays which card first — and sometimes it's every player for herself!

The card deck features forty cards in four suits, with each card featuring a "Primiera" value. Each round starts with four cards face-up on the table and nine cards in each player's hand. On a turn, a player must play one card to the table to try to capture one or more cards that sum to that card's value; if a player can't or doesn't want to do this, she must lay one card on the table. If you manage to clear all the cards from play, you score one point for a sweep.

The first player to lay down a Herald (which are all valued "1") determines her partner based on the direction of the arrow on that card. At the end of the round, teams combine their cards and score points, with each individual recording those points for herself. In the end, only one player can win!
166333.name: Primiera

166334.name: Pixel Piracy
videogamehonor: 2014 AzPlay Awards Best Game Design Nominee
2014 AzPlay Awards Most Re-Playable Game Nominee
166334.description:
In the game, the player controls the crew of a pirate ship. The player must sail the ship over a number of sea zones, each with procedurally generated events in a roguelike fashion, while facing pirates and other hostile forces, recruiting new crew members, keeping discipline, outfitting, upgrading ship and more.

Source: The Developer Website.

166335.name: Journey of the Emperor
166335.description:
In Journey of the Emperor players are attempting to create the best experience for the emperor during the Qingming Festival. The Emperor wishes to leave the castle and see different things on his walk along the river. The organizer that can provide him with the most desirable experience will be the winner.

Each round players will select a card representing a part of the festival and place it in a path in front of them. The full layout of cards, from castle on the left to coast on the right with the festival in between is considered a journey. Players will organize multiple journeys during a game. The goal is to figure out the best sequence to play your cards in order to score the most points and be declared the best festival organizer.

A game can take between 6 to 16 turns depending on the number of players and points are awarded for each journey depending on the Castle and Coast cards played. Each scoring card seeks out varying combinations of Dragons, Pandas, Tigers and Chows. In addition each player has hidden goals involving lanterns, animals and castle combinations.

166336.name: The Last Parsec Primer
166336.description:
From publisher blurb:

Faster-than-light travel has finally allowed humanity to spread beyond its lonely corner of the Milky Way. In the depths of space these explorers found millions of star systems, strange planets, and exotic alien races. Centuries later, they form the Known Worlds, a vital region of trade and technology where empires grow and business thrives.

It is an unparalleled age. Cutting edge science has opened limitless frontiers of space and consciousness, and has even begun to hint at the mysteries of the universe itself. But to find them, one must travel beyond the familiar, to the last parsecs of reality.

This Primer paves the way for an expanded core book to come!

166337.name: Guardian Path Abilities II
166337.description:
From publisher blurb:

Guardian Path Abilities II brings you 7 brand-new mythic path abilities for the Guardian path, from aerial defenses like Eyes on the Skies and Skyshield to abilities no ever-ready sentinel should be without like Battlemagic Sense and Chargebreaker!

166338.name: Adventure Time: Battle Party
166338.description:
From Wikipedia: Adventure Time: Battle Party is a browser-based Unity Web Player Multiplayer online battle arena game made by Cartoon Network. Like other Multiplayer online battle arena games such as League of Legends and Dota 2 the player and team take down the other team's base. Unlike other MOBAs, players cannot level up their skill or buy items. Instead players customize their characters via pre-made"backpacks" that give different stat bonuses. Matches can either be PVP or against AI. Matches end either when one team's base is destroyed or when time runs out. Upon time-out, the team with the most points wins.

Source: Wikipedia, "Adventure Time: Battle Party," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

166340.name: The Golden Spike
166340.description:
The United States of America, 1863-69. Two railroad lines, one starting in California and the other in Iowa, set out to create a seriously divided nation’s first transcontinental railroad. In The Golden Spike, two players take on the role of a railroad magnate, building half of this famous accomplishment in transportation. It’s a race, to be sure, and the first player to reach Promontory Summit, Utah gains prestige and bonus money. However, the winner of the game is the player who makes the most profit along the way, which requires a delicate balance of planning and cunning.

Players alternately select three-card stacks from a row of them, with only one of the three cards visible. These allow the players to perform various actions, such as hiring workers and buying materials, both needed in the construction of the railroad sections they'll need to complete to get to Promontory Summit... and sometimes men and materials may be hoarded and in short supply. If an Inspector appears when turning over a face-down card, a turn ends immediately and no actions are executed. Three terrain types present a quandary for both players: faster construction or greater profits.

166341.description:
In any battle of Good vs. Evil, there are those who root for the noble, wholesome characters, and those who cheer on the corrupt and dishonorable. In the game of 7&7, you get to choose which side you're on. The object of the game is to fill your play area with all seven VIRTUES or all seven SINS to claim the victory, but watch out: Your opponents will be attempting to do the exact same thing, and will be trying to turn your characters against you!

Features:

Dual sided cards grant you the flexibility to adjust to an ever changing game state.
Convert cards to either bring you closer to victory or to disrupt your opponents.
Fast-paced actions ensures that turns are always quick and exciting.

166342.name: You Don't Know Jack: The Netshow
166342.description:
User Summary

Sometimes a CD-ROM just isn't enough. You Don't Know Jack: the netshow brings home a slightly different version of the popular quiz show game via the Internet -- and for free. Several five to 15-second commercials pay for this online version of YDKJ, which features a new episode every Monday. Were you too busy one week and missed an episode of YDKJTN? Relax. There's a feature built in that enables you to play (or replay) past episodes, by yourself of with up to two friends.

166343.name: You Don't Know Jack Sports Netshow
166343.description:
User Summary

This is a sports version of the comedic pop-culture quiz show with the brash host and is free for play. There's different categories such as Pro Athletes & Other Large Corporations and Gibberish Questions where you must decipher a common sports cliché, term, etc. from a sentence that makes no sense. One time per round you can "screw your neighbor" by forcing an opponent to answer a question and if they answer wrong, they lose points. But if they answer correctly then you lose the points. There's three rounds of 14 questions and a Jack Attack lightning round. Whoever has the most points at the end, wins.

166344.name: You Don't Know Jack: Offline
videogamehonor: 2000 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)
videogamecompilation: You Don't Know Jack Offline Collection
166344.description:
User Summary

You Don't Know Jack is back with more questions and wry commentary in You Don't Know Jack: Offline. The game features fast-action trivia competition for up to three players. As in other versions, the "screw" your competitor feature is available in this game, allowing a player to force other contestants to answer questions he thinks they won't know. A new question type is also available. This "Offline" edition features questions from You Don't Know Jack: the Netshow, an online-only version of the popular party game.

166345.name: You Don't Know Jack: 5th Dementia
166345.description:
User Summary

Following in the footsteps of previous Jellyvision and Berkeley Systems releases, You Don't Know Jack: 5th Dementia contains more than 600 new questions, presented in a similar style to previous games in the series with the same quick and caustic wit. In addition to the new questions and a new association-based type of question known as Bug Out, the most significant advance in this edition is the game's multiplayer options.

166346.name: You Don't Know Jack: Mock 2
166346.description:
User Summary

The second volume of Seirra's You Don't Know Jack series comes to the PlayStaion in You Don't Know Jack Mock 2. Gameplay follows the conventions established in the first You Don't Know Jack game, featuring fast-paced trivia questions and a witty, if not mildly insulting, announcer. The television gameshow-styled interface enjoys a smoother 3D presentation in this installment. You Don't Know Jack Mock 2 features 750 new questions and a new type of questions called "CoinkyDinks." With enough controllers, the game can support up to three players (or teams) competing at once.

166347.name: You Don't Know Jack (iOS)
166347.description:
User Summary

A version of the popular trivia game You Don't Know Jack for the I-phone and I-pad devices.

166348.name: Poltergeist Heist
166348.description:
Poltergeist Heist is a competitive game for 1-5 players that takes 75 minutes to play.

In Poltergeist Heist you must collect clues in order to find the hidden ghosts. Once the ghost is revealed you must act quickly to trap him, otherwise another player may claim the prize.

166349.name: You Don't Know Jack (Facebook)
166349.description:
User Summary

Version of You Don't Know Jack for Facebook.

166350.name: You Don't Know Jack (OUYA)
166350.description:
User Summary

Version of You Don't Know Jack for the OUYA console.

166351.name: You Don't Know Jack Party
166351.description:
User Summary

It’s multiplayer YOU DON’T KNOW JACK! And your phones are the controllers!

166352.name: Conclave: A Game of Decisions
166352.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




designer summary

Conclave is a setting agnostic story telling RPG where you play as a group of people faced with a problem (anything from the colonists of your outer space world are disappearing or you're trying to stop a group of cultists from raising Cthulhu).

166353.name: Airships vs Aliens
166353.description:
Airships vs Aliens is a quick strategy boardgame for two players, with one player defending the Earth with ten Steampunk Airship miniatures, while the opposing player attempts to win the invasion using ten alien ship miniatures. The game is pure strategy with no luck elements involved.

Each side has 5 Gunships, 3 Warships and 2 Commandships. The first player to eliminiate both opposing Commandships wins. Each turn a player takes actions with one piece. An action is moving one square forward in the direction facing, turning the ship 90 degrees or firing the long range guns. Gunships have no long range guns, Warships have them with a range of 1 square forward and Commandship long guns can fire with a range of 2 squares forward. Gunships have up to 4 actions when moved, Warships have 3 and Commandships have 2.

To deepen the strategy each side has 5 command tokens that one can be used during a turn to give a ship an extra action. Another strategy element is that when you lose Warships or Commandships you may be able to bring a destroyed ship back to board as reinforcements.

166354.name: 868-HACK
videogamehonor: 2014 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
2014 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
166354.description:
Okay what's changed from the 7 day version?
basically: A LOT.
- new programs.
- almost all the old programs ones modified (some in very subtle ways).
- a tutorial (skip this if you enjoy figuring out everything for yourself).
- better balanced.
- online high scores.
- streak scores too (sum across consecutive plays without dying).
- more graphics and sounds.
- so many little details I can't remember off the top of my head.
- secret stuff.

I should repeat about the tutorial: some people really enjoyed the blind confusion of working out all the mechanics themselves, and if that might be you then it's totally reasonable to skip it - you can always go back to it later. I've gone back and forth over whether it was right to include one at all, but ultimately most players were completely lost without some guidance and there's very much a game worth playing still there even once you understand what all the rules are. I still find it interesting to play myself and I know every detail of how it works.
Oh also - don't expect to understand everything after just the tutorial. It gives you the basics, but you still have to figure out how to put them together.

Also, several programs start out locked. Feel free to hit "unlock all" if you want to skip that, but I'd recommend going for the gradual introduction, you'll get a better understanding of the interactions between them.

Thanks so much to everyone who's helped out with this, with testing and suggestions. In particular, massive thanks to Leon Arnott, who in addition to helping out by writing most of the victory text and some of the intro text, made numerous excellent suggestions. And then repeated the suggestions when I didn't pay attention. And tirelessly kept on repeating them until I actually got around to trying them out and realised he'd been right all along. He also made a fan page (somewhat deceptive). Bless Leon.

get itttttt
(or, if you don't have one of those devices have patience I'll get a version you can play when I can! sorry!)
(also could someone please beat my high scores? ta.)

Source: The Developer Website.

166355.name: Chaos Code
166355.description:
Chaos Code (カオスコード Kaosu Kōdo) is a fighting game developed by FK Digital and published by Arc System Works. The game was released for Sega's RingWide arcade system board on August 4, 2011. A port for the PlayStation 3 was first released on December 19, 2012 on Hong Kong's PlayStation Network, followed by subsequent home releases in both Japan and North America in 2013 and Europe in 2014.

The game uses a standard 8-way lever and four button (weak punch, weak kick, strong punch, strong kick) system. Characters can be customized prior to the fight, such as selecting two "edit special moves" from four possibilities to go along with the character's built-in attacks. Players can also select between "run" and "step" modes, placing the focus respectively on speed and technical play. The game makes use of a couple of systems that can quickly change the flow of battle:

Destruction Chaos: A high level super move that, if successfully connects, can eliminate half of the opponent's life gauge.
Exceed Chaos: Place the character into a special status which removes limitations on combos

Source: Wikipedia, "Chaos Code", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

166356.name: Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate
videogamehonor: 2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Mutliplayer Experience of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
166356.description:
Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate is an updated version of Dead or Alive 5. Ultimate includes new modes and some features from Dead or Alive 5 Plus, as well as several new stages and fighters, and all-new features such as two-on-two online multiplayer tag team battles.

A free digital version, titled Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate: Core Fighters, which features four playable characters and the online mode, with additional characters and story mode content available as purchasable downloadable content.

Dead or Alive 5 Last Round is the third updated version of 2012's Dead or Alive 5. Last Round includes all the features and content from Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate with additional new costumes and customizable hairstyles, as well as two new characters and two new stages. The original Dead or Alive boss Raidou returns as a cyborg, along with a new female character named Honoka. The PlayStation 4 and Xbox One versions will feature upgraded graphics, running at 1080p resolution and 60 frames per second. The game uses a new Soft Engine, designed to better depict "softness" of characters' bodies.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

166357.description:
In Bumble Bees: The Nest Building Game you are the Queen of a Bumble Bee colony racing to expand your Nest in the Spring. The only problem is you're old and dying. Will you be able to grow your Nest soon enough for a New Queen to be born, or will your colony be wiped out first?

Decide which actions to take with four unique, double sided Bees. The Queen, Worker, Nest Worker, and Drone.

Every turn Event cards are drawn that might have minor, or major effects on gameplay.

Turn you Bumble Bee nest into a resource creating factory by expanding it. You can add new chambers such as Brooding Bees, Honeypots, and Involucrum.

Each game decide where you nest came from, by picking an Origin Card, such as Rodent Nest, Hibernation Hole, or Tree Trunk.
166357.name: Bumble Bees: The Nest Building Game

166358.name: Ragnarok Tactics
166358.description:
The game is considered a spin-off to the original game in the series, Ragnarok Online. However, unlike Ragnarok Online, which is a massively multiplayer online role-playing game, Ragnarok Tactics is a tactical role-playing game, playing more similarly to Final Fantasy Tactics. However, elements of the Ragnarok Online universe are still present, such as similar settings or the fact that crouching/sitting can restore character's health.

The game is played on a grid, where the player must move characters strategically to cause damage to the opposing party, with the end goal usually to defeat the opposing side.

Customization is strongly emphasized in the game; with characters' genders, statistics, skills, equipment all being customizable. Furthermore, the player can chose to join three different factions, and make different choices to take different paths throughout the game, leading to five different endings. The game does not require players to replay the game five times to see each ending, but rather, the player can opt to go back to crucial points in the game and chose a different path. Optional sidequests, largely unconnected to the main story characters, are also available to play at various points in the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ragnarok Tactics", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

166359.name: Anomaly Defenders
166359.description:
Anomaly Defenders is the latest installment in Anomaly series which introduced an idea of Tower Offense gameplay. However, this time the tables have turned. Humans have resisted the invasion and launched a counter attack. Now it's time for aliens to defend.

Anomaly Defenders puts you in charge of alien machines defending their homeplanet from ruthless human invaders. Build towers in strategically chosen designated spots. Develop and upgrade unique tech trees to increase towers' efficiency. Deploy your special functions for the multiplied impact. Protect your species or die.

Source: The Developer Website.

166360.name: Bridge Constructor Playground
166360.description:
Imagine Bridge Constructor with a default free-build mode and each level offering five challenges to master. That is the concept of Bridge Constructor Playground! Tackle each level without constraints and freely build your bridges to move on to the next level. If you want to enter the next island, however, you have to bring a number of badges that can be earned in the levels. The badges belong to different categories that offer different challenges: safety badges demand to stay below a certain maximum stress amount, whereas material badges require the use of only certain materials. All in all, the game offers 160 challenges to master on four islands!

Source: The Developer Website.

166361.name: Exit: Escape from the Bunker
166361.description:
User Summary

Exit: Escape from the Bunker is a FPS where you will find yourself in a labyrinth, strange creatures attacking you. You will need fight your way out to the surface, through 20 levels. Time isn't on your side either, so you need to hurry. Exit: Escape from the Bunker has retro pixelated graphics and an old-school FPS feel to it.

166362.name: Blop From Space
166362.description:
Blob From Space is a 2d side scroller platform game. The blob comes in peace! With easy to learn gameplay and hard enough challenges it's fun for everyone!

Source: The Developer Website.

166363.name: 500 Years Act 1
166363.description:
The Earth was dying and humanity boarded ships to colonize the stars. These ships were named after the wonders of the ancient world: The Giza, The Alexandria, The Rhodes and finally, The Artemis.

The Artemis landed and set up a colony on an Earth-like moon. Then the Ants, an insectoid species, came and enslaved the colony. All hope was lost.

Years later you were born in the Artemis colony and joined the resistance against the Ants.

One day the Ants suddenly left your colony for unknown reasons. The Proctor of your colony tasked you with finding the ancient Artemis colony ship. Among the wreckage you found the captain's yacht; and it still works! You and your crew take to the stars to find the other humans, if they are still out there. 500 years after the destruction of Earth...

500 Years is an old school episodic space opera. The game is an adventure where you explore different star systems and meet the inhabitants, some friendly, and some not so friendly.

Source: The Developer Website.

166365.name: Super Cyborg
166365.description:
Super Cyborg is an old-school nonstop hardcore run'n'gun action!

Game features:

3 difficulty levels (easy, normal, hard - unlocks when you'll beat normal mode)
local cooperative (2 players mode)
7 hardcore levels
awesome chiptune soundtrack
many unique bosses and enemies




Source: The Developer Website.

166366.name: Cyberpunk 3776
166366.description:
Cyberpunk 3776 harkens back to the glory days of arcade shoot-em-ups. It all begins on a postapocalyptic earth and proceeds into space. Ultimately, your journey will be a metaphor about life and death, a road that every person has to walk down alone. The only choices you get while on your path to the inevitable end: keep your head up high or forfeit.

The game features a bold atmosphere with seven unique stages. Each of them includes a unique boss that will challenge your skills. Cyberpunk 3776 boasts hours of breathtaking action, ship upgrades, floating healthpods and great voice acting from Nico Uusitalo.

Cyberpunk 3776 was made by Peter Hann using Unity3D and Playmaker. The music was composed by Gabe Castro, Calbert Warner and Kevin MacLeod.

Source: The Game Website.

166367.name: Armies of Alamar
166367.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – IN BETA




This game is in Beta and has not been fully released yet.




User Summary

Armies of Alamar combines a beautiful 3 dimensional castle and village building process with a 3 dimensional world that allows you as a player to interact with everyone. You can conquer lands or become the leader of a county. Or you can discover the Realm under the Realm. Explore the vast Dungeons as you rise in your power. You could learn the truth behind the scenes of Alamar.

166368.name: Mystery Case Files: Fate's Carnival
166368.description:
Madame Fate returns… from the dead! This is Fate’s Carnival as you’ve never seen it before, with old acts like Amazing Larry and Marlena Mermaid in the most harrowing predicaments! Can you stop fate before it’s too late? Or will the creepy carnival curse stop you?

Source: The Publisher Website.

166369.name: Skillion
166369.description:
A two player abstract game played with two sets (black and white) of triangular pieces on a hexagonal board. The board has 96 triangular shapes in blue, yellow and red. Players alternate playing one piece at a time trying to form complete hexagons of their own colour. Red areas cannot be played on until they become the only exposed area in a hexagon and at that point may only be played on when the play would creat a complete hexagon all of one colour, in which case that player wins.
Should no complete uni-coloured hexagon be formed when all legal plays have been made there is a point scoring system to determine the winner.

166370.name: Mystery Case Files: Shadow Lake
166370.description:
Uncover the evil legend that haunts a forgotten town in Mystery Case Files: Shadow Lake! In 1973, something wicked took over the town of Bitterford, Maine, after an unsuspecting inmate unearthed a mysterious object from beneath the prison floor.

Years later, Bitterford lies in ruin. You must join forces with psychic Cassandra Williams, played by award-winning actress Lea Thompson, to investigate the events that led to the town's destruction.

Only you can expose the evil that lurks in the depths of Shadow Lake. But beware... What you discover may haunt you forever.

Source: The Publisher Website.

166371.description:
Inspired by Mexican Lucha Libre Wrestling, El Luchador Fantastico Grande challenges you to become either a hero in the ring, or a villain that teams up and then chair shots people to the face!

Inspired by Mexican Lucha Libre Wrestling,El Luchador Fantastico Grande challenges you to become a righteous hero, or vile villain, in the ring. Fight alone, or team up with another player, and then chair shot your team-mate in the face! Do whatever it takes to win the coveted title belt and claim your spot as the greatest Luchador of all time.

El Luchador Fantastico Grande is a standalone card and dice tabletop game that challenges players to become Mexican wrestling super-stars. Players compete to see who can outlast and knock out all opponents or play in one of the three different match modes. Are you ready to become the ultimate Luchador Wrestler?

El Luchador Fantastico Grande is designed for anyone who loves tabletop gaming, no requirement to know ANYTHING about wrestling.

At the start of each turn, you roll four dice. The dice show the following three symbols: Heal, Miss and Attack. Over three successive throws, choose whether to keep or discard each die in order to restore health, or attack other players.

The strongest wrestler will control the ELFG Title Belt, and be able to deal additional damage, but that player can't heal!

Top this off with a special communal card deck that allows players to deal extra damage, heal, change die results and even counter other players cards!

In order to win the game, one must be the only surviving wrestler once the fighting has ended.
166371.name: El Luchador Fantastico Grande
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 34 - Vault Wars

166372.description:
As a medieval ruler your aim is to develop crafts, build efficient production chains, and make your city thrive. Produce, transform, gather resources, and don't forget to hinder your opponents!

Artificium is a card-driven development game. Some cards produce resources or transform one type of resources into another and award victory points, while others let you perform actions. Carefully planning the chain of cards that you will play during the game turn is the key to success.

Artificium lasts four turns. At the start of each turn, players have five cards in hand, with six cards being face-up on the table as a card market. During the turn, players first have a chance to exchange some cards from their hands with those in the market, then they play and resolve their cards step by step, performing actions, trading and gathering resources, and most importantly, refining certain resources into other resources to earn victory points. Crystals on the players' individual resource boards keep track of their resources as they are bought and sold. Crystals placed beside the board represent player's coins. The final score is determined after the fourth turn, with players selling any remaining resources to score additional victory points (one point per four coins). The player with the most victory points is considered to be the wisest medieval ruler and is declared the winner.
166372.name: Artificium
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep. 17 – Randomness in Board Games | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers

166373.description:
A special set of cards with a Tric Trac theme.

Three workers :

Monsieur Node
Docteur Mops
Monsieur Phal




One building :

l'Officine Tric Trac.
166373.name: Les Bâtisseurs: Moyen-Âge – L'officine Tric Trac
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG 4: Sabotage

166374.name: Rambleropoly
166374.description:
All of the spaces on the game board, feature advertisements of the many stores and businesses in the town of McBain, Michigan. You go around as you would on monopoly and buy, sell and trade property.

This version [2013 Edition] is the first edition of the game, released by the McBain High School, it was released for sporting events and gifted to the 2013 graduating class.

166375.description:
A promo card for Seasons available in Plato n°67.

Prestige Point : -5
Invocation cost : 1 energy of each type.

Receive 20 crystals
The cost for claiming all your power cards in hand - worth less than 12 Prestige Point - is now 5 crystals
166375.name: Seasons: Orb of Ragfield

166376.name: Villains: Accelerated (Supers!)
166376.description:
From publisher blurb:

Villains: Accelerated for SUPERS! is a treasury of supervillains statted up and ready for action right now.

Villains: Accelerated contains

Professor Hebanon - Demonic Mad Scientist with a split personality in the tradition of Jason Blood/The Demon and Bruce Banner/Hulk
Megafauna - a fun-loving, size-changing villain who lives for the joy of super-combat
Cold-Blooded - ice cold, superhuman Godfather
The Interceptor - freelance super‐thug who specializes in helping drive off superheros
Xiphos - Obligatory Badass Super Ninja
Dr. Lucas Westerly - a mad scientist in the mold of colorful characters like Victor Frankenstein and Rotwang.
Hoodwink - a self-styled "revolutionary" superhuman who promises to tear down the existing social order.
Dead Eye - Mysterious scourge of the underworld who secretly is working for one of the city's top crime families

166377.name: Japanese Vehicles of the Second World War
rpgseries: Vehicles of the Second World War
166377.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dominant force in the Pacific in during the middle stages of the war, the Japanese military played a desperate gamble to knock out its American and European enemies before the full weight of their retaliation could be brought to bear. Spearheaded by sea and air power, the vehicles presented in this book were used on the islands of the Pacific as the war leapt from one to another. Though not facing the massive armoured conflicts of Europe and Africa, the vehicles the Japanese employed during the war were nevertheless interesting and varied.

This supplement for Traveller introduces many vehicles that formed the fighting arm of Japan in the Second World War, and provides full details of each, allowing them to be used within games. The weapons unique to Japan are also covered, along with enough information for you to use them in your own games and own vehicle designs.

Uses in Traveller

The vehicles found in this book could potentially form the basis of a campaign set in the Second World War. They may also be of interest to those who are simply curious as to how real-world vehicles can be implemented using the Traveller vehicle design system. However, we suspect many more players will want to actually use them in their games, even on planets far in the future and hundreds of light years away!

We have provided game mechanics for many vehicles, from the devastatingly agile Mitsubishi Zero, to the Type 95 tank but, at the end of the day, a Type 95 need not look like a Type 95 if it were built to these specifications on an alien world. It could end up looking very different but have the same characteristics listed in this book. By this token, what this book provides is a solid set of military vehicles available at Tech Level 5. A referee can use them to fully flesh out a military force on a Tech Level 5 world and provide interesting variations on themes in order to give his world more depth.

For example, a referee creating a military force for a new world may simply design a single main battle tank for it before moving on to the artillery piece, the fighter plane, and so on. With this book, he can present a military force that has a defined timeline with the development of its vehicles, so there is not just one main battle tank but several, each a replacement of the one before though with all still in service, with the very best units getting the latest generation of tank.

Players can have fun with this book as well, especially if they are engaging in paramilitary actions or running their own mercenary force. What this book will provide them is a list of Tech Level 5 vehicles that, while outmatched by more sophisticated enemies, will be perfectly serviceable (and at a cheaper price!) on more primitive worlds and will be capable of standing up against infantry from higher Tech Levels – at least, until plasma weaponry and missiles become prevalent.

166378.name: Nysilor: Archipelago of Ashes
166378.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ancient races, unseen enemies, and dark supernatural forces surround you. The world has changed and the gods and spirits are either silent or warped by the chaos and evil infesting the land. It is a time of pain, war, and fear, a time for heroes to rise, before the shadow of death falls across everything and everyone. Welcome to the ruins of a better world, welcome to the Archipelago of Ashes…

In this product you will find....

Cultural Overviews
Location Overviews
Setting Background
Character Concepts
A new pantheon
GM advice
A ten part campaign outline




This is the starting point of a journey around the world which has many names and beyond...

Welcome to Nysilor, The Archipelago of Ashes

This product and those that follow in this line will detail a generic setting inspired by Pan-Pacific cultures mixed with fantasy and science fantasy. The core document will be updated periodically and new products will detail regions, items, heroes, creatures, and more...

166379.name: Nysilor: Archipelago of Ashes - An Explorer's Guide
166379.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Explorer's Guide provides setting background, Descriptions of the nations of the archipelago, and its peoples.

This is taken from Nysilor: Archipelago of Ashes and contains the player information without GM secrets or the adventure outline in the core document.

166380.name: Babala
166380.description:
From publisher blurb:


Babala, City of the Sunrise

“Great was her splendor in those days [before the Atuang] when she was the bright jewel of the isle of L’yim. Wealth was abundant and no ship sailed the waters of Nysilor without harboring there. Then the Uqtari came and brought war and death with them diminishing the city. But it was the desperation of the Tesuteyi that spelled her doom…”

One of the Three Cities of ancient Nysilor, Babala was the first to fall to the invasion led by the Gien and their Uqtari followers. Now it is a great ruin home to lost souls, desperate people, and dark cults...

166381.name: Saru Dn - The City of Kuddum
166381.description:
From publisher blurb:


Kuddum, Sister City

“Kuddum grew into a great city in Babala’s shadow. Goods, riches, merchants, and mercenaries called the city home. She was a city of gold, stripped of her wealth and hope by the coming of the Gien.”

Kuddum was a reflection of Babala in the past, in the present she is her sister’s only heir…

In Kuddum you can find wealth, dark magic, and death. Read about her history, her present, and those who call her ruins home.

166382.name: Saru Dn - The City of Sur
166382.description:
From publisher blurb:


Saru Dn (Sur), War’s City

“Pride of the clans, and heart of the people Saru Dn was unassailable, or so we thought. Then came the Uqtari and with them the Gien. Pride became shame, and our heart was torn out. When the city collapsed the last hope of freedom went with it and our tears fell upon the face of Uru.”

Welcome to the third installment of the series, in these pages you will learn some of the secrets of the ruined city from which Saru Dn, largest island of the archiepelago takes its name... In ancient times it was Saru Dn, War's City, now it is a shadow of itself known as Sur.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
166384.description:
Spyfall is a party game unlike any other, one in which you get to be a spy and try to understand what's going on around you. It's really simple!

Spyfall is played over several rounds, and at the start of each round all players receive cards showing the same location — a casino, a traveling circus, a pirate ship, or even a space station — except that one player receives a card that says "Spy" instead of the location. Players then start asking each other questions — "Why are you dressed so strangely?" or "When was the last time we got a payday?" or anything else you can come up with — trying to guess who among them is the spy. The spy doesn't know where he is, so he has to listen carefully. When it's his time to answer, he'd better create a good story!

At any time during a round, one player may accuse another of being a spy. If all other players agree with the accusation, the round ends and the accused player has to reveal his identity. If the spy is uncovered, all other players score points. However, the spy can himself end a round by announcing that he understands what the secret location is; if his guess is correct, only the spy scores points.

After a few rounds of guessing, suspicion and bluffing, the game ends and whoever has scored the most points is victorious!
166384.name: Spyfall
boardgamepodcastepisode: #83 – Dox Talks – Lance “Undead Viking” Myxter
BGA Ep 66 - If You Like Carcassonne, Try...
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 010 – Our 2016 Wishlist

The Long View - Quick Looks #5
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 35!!!

166385.name: Shackled Lands - Iyaso Dn
166385.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the next installment in the Forgotten Corners of the Archipelago product line. This document will focus on the city known to Angdesi and Armir as "Iyanda's City".

It will discuss the population, layout, and oddities of the city. Included are several adventure hooks to help you start a game in this deadliest of Nysilor's cities.

Iyaso Dn, Iyanda’s City

“The city is a place of suffering and pain like no other. Even the Uqtari fear its depredations, and the presence of Iyanda deepens this fear.”

166386.name: Dues for the Dead
166386.description:
From the Front Cover:

For years, the Most Solemn Order of the Silent Shroud has tended the dead at Valinghen graveyard, providing them a peaceful eternal rest. Now, that rest has been disturbed by a necromancer seeking out a key to re-activate the Pool of Radiance. An adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

From the Introduction:

Welcome to Dues for the Dead, a D&D Expeditions adventure, part of the official D&D Adventurers League organized play system and the Tyranny of Dragons storyline season.

This adventure is designed for three to seven 1st-4th level characters, and is optimized for five 2nd level characters. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure. Players with ineligible characters can create a new 1st-level character or use a pregenerated character.

The adventure takes place in Phlan, a large city on the shore of the Moonsea, in the Forgotten Realms. More specifically, it takes place almost entirely in and beneath the city's cemetery, Valhingen Graveyard.

166387.name: The Courting of Fire
166387.description:
From the Front Cover:

An exiled cultist and his kobold minions are spotted searching long-forgotten ruins in the Dragonspire Mountains. Rumors say he looks for a precious gift to give to a fearsome dragon that dwells there. What he hopes to attain with his gift is unknown, but can't be good for the citizens of Phlan. An adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

From the Introduction:

Welcome to The Courting of Fire, a D&D Expeditions adventure, part of the official D&D Adventurers League organized play system and the Tyranny of Dragons storyline season.

This adventure is designed for three to seven 1st-4th level characters, and is optimized for five 2nd level characters. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure. Players with ineligible characters can create a new 1st-level character or use a pregenerated character.

The adventure begins in the bustling frontier town of Phlan, but the adventurers soon find themselves trekking northwest into the treacherous Dragonspine Mountains.

166388.name: Vampire Mafia
166388.description:
Please welcome the re-invented classic: Vampire Mafia — the secret identity party game! Some might say that Vampire Mafia is inspired by Werewolf, but quite the opposite is true as Mafia first appeared in the USSR in 1986, then later emerged in the USA in a much softer form as Werewolf.

Vampire Mafia is the TRUE Russian mafia-like game, based on a few decades of player feedback. It includes the most interesting cards and scenario variants, extensive guide for the moderator. Be prepared for the challenge; see the game the way it is meant to be played!

Did we mention that Vampire Mafia inhabits a unique setting, one in which vampires are good guys who are ready to spill the blood of the vampire hunters, who are the forces of evil? Well, there it goes!

166389.name: The Scroll Thief
166389.description:
From the Front Cover:

Scholars Square is a relatively quiet corner of Phlan, but a series of odd thefts have the headmasters of various school in the area concerned. The headmasters' pleas for help have gone unanswered by the Black Fist, and the Lord Sage of Phlan decides to reach out to you and your kind to bring those responsible to justice. An adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

From the Introduction:

Welcome to The Scroll Thief, a D&D Expeditions adventure, part of the official D&D Adventurers League organized play system and the Tyranny of Dragons storyline season.

This adventure is designed for three to seven 1st-4th level characters, and is optimized for five 2nd level characters. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure. Players with ineligible characters can create a new 1st-level character or use a pregenerated character.

The adventure is set in the city of Phlan in the Cracked Crown inn, but turns explores a number of different locations in Scholar's Square before plumbing the depths of the ruins beneath Mantor's Library and the sewers beneath Phlan.

166390.description:
You are invited to an exciting railway journey in Europe – from Moscow to Paris, from Rome to Berlin. Build your own routes, play wagon cards and watch your opponents!

Moscow to Paris is a quick and easy card game. Four city cards are revealed and placed for all to see. Then players try to match wagon cards played besides cities to wagon cards that they play in their own areas. There are also special cards and cities that bend the rules. You can even add your own city to the game!

A traveler that visited the most cities will win the game!
166390.name: Moscow to Paris

166391.name: Meazy N More!
166391.description:
Meazy N More! is essentially a game system, comprising 144 dice — 36 for each player, 6 each in 6 colors. You can play with two copies of the game to allow 5–8 players. An unusual feature of this game system is that there are core rules that all the games use. The core rules instruct players to roll their dice, form legal combinations for the game they're playing, then put their unused dice back in their "rolling bins", and pass them to the left. Each such round of veritable drafting is called a "shake". Shakes continue until someone wins the game.

Meazy N More! comes with rules for four games built upon those core rules:

In Eazy Meazy (30 minutes, ages 5+), you must build a "pyramid" of dice: 1×1 though 6×6; however, each "level" of one number must be a different color, and once a die is assigned to a level, that level's color is locked.
Not So Eazy Meazy (30 minutes, ages 5+) differs from Eazy Meazy by allowing the player to choose on the fly which number goes in each level; rearranging is completely legal.
Meazy Street (90 minutes, ages 8+) is the featured game (ages 8+). In addition to forming a pyramid, you must form a "straight" and a "rainbow", but these things must be done in a particular sequence. Unlike the previous two games, you calculate your score for the round based on the combinations you form.
Splitting Headache (90 minutes, ages 8+) is billed as a bonus game. In this game, you try to form the four different types of "splits", after which you may work to form the "banana split" out of the remaining dice. You calculate your score for the round based on the splits you formed by the time the round ended.




Further games for the system will be released as expansion packs and/or downloads from the publisher's website.

166392.name: Aonir Roolipeli
166392.description:
User summary:
Aonir is a fantasy RPG created and published by Teemu Suontaka in 2014 as part of his master's thesis on degree of business economics used as a case example of getting from idea to product. It is available for sale as PDF on the RPG's official website and a free preview PDF about the game is also available.

In Aonir a fantasy world is invaded by alien tzerads, which causes steampunk technology development and appearance of mutated, green skinned orc race. The magic in Aonir is mostly based on psionics and alchemy. The game uses mainly d6 and d12 dice and also d12+d6 which is written as d18. The rules system is Teemu's own design but the main inspirations are from D&D and Praedor. The book includes seven character classes from mystic to ranger, three playable races: humans, mutated orcs and alien tzerads and all together over 70 weapons, spells and magic potions. The art for Aonir is all found from rpgnow.com under free-to-use license.

166393.name: Spellbook Cards: Arcane
166393.description:
From the back cover:

Contains 231 durable, laminated cards for all Wizard, Warlock, and Sorceror spells, from level 1 to 9. A perfect reference tool for spellcasters of every type.

Publisher blurb:

This deck of spell cards [is] an invaluable resource for any magic-user. Consult the entire deck when selecting new spells to learn, and after a long rest you can set aside those spells you want to prepare for the day. Each deck is made from thick laminated card so they will stand the test of time.


Spell name and important info is easy to find for quick reference.



Descriptive/Mechanical text is written in full wherever possible. When it isn't, a Player's Handbook page reference is given.



Scaling spells have an additional section with details on how they improve.



Card backs prominently display spell level for easy sorting.



The Spell cards are highly durable and are made to last. Each card has a coating that protects them and makes them safe to use with dry erase markers.



Contains 231 cards for all Wizard, Warlock and Sorcerer spells from level 1-9.

166394.name: Spellbook Cards: Paladin
166394.description:
From the back cover:

Contains 45 durable, laminated cards for all Paladin spells, from level 1 to 5. A perfect reference tool for spellcasters of every type.

Publisher blurb:

This deck of spell cards [is] an invaluable resource for any magic-user. Consult the entire deck when selecting new spells to learn, and after a long rest you can set aside those spells you want to prepare for the day. Each deck is made from thick laminated card so they will stand the test of time.


Spell name and important info is easy to find for quick reference.



Descriptive/Mechanical text is written in full wherever possible. When it isn't, a Player's Handbook page reference is given.



Scaling spells have an additional section with details on how they improve.



Card backs prominently display spell level for easy sorting.



The Spell cards are highly durable and are made to last. Each card has a coating that protects them and makes them safe to use with dry erase markers.



Contains all 45 Paladin spell cards from level 1 to 5.

166395.name: Spellbook Cards: Ranger
166395.description:
From the back cover:

Contains 46 durable, laminated cards for all Ranger spells, from level 1 to 5. A perfect reference tool for spellcasters of every type.

Publisher blurb:

This deck of spell cards [is] an invaluable resource for any magic-user. Consult the entire deck when selecting new spells to learn, and after a long rest you can set aside those spells you want to prepare for the day. Each deck is made from thick laminated card so they will stand the test of time.


Spell name and important info is easy to find for quick reference.



Descriptive/Mechanical text is written in full wherever possible. When it isn't, a Player's Handbook page reference is given.



Scaling spells have an additional section with details on how they improve.



Card backs prominently display spell level for easy sorting.



The Spell cards are highly durable and are made to last. Each card has a coating that protects them and makes them safe to use with dry erase markers.



Contains all 46 Ranger spell cards from level 1 to 5.

166396.name: Road to Heaven Board Game
166396.description:
Road to Heaven Board Game is a fun multi-sensory game created to bring families together & bring the Bible alive in the hearts of all ages and backgrounds thereby drawing them to God and on their own Road to Heaven. The Road to Heaven was developed to provide people of all ages and backgrounds the opportunity to experience and learn the Word of God as spoken through our Lord Jesus Christ and as written in the Bible while having fun through an interactive multi-sensory game.

Travel 157 spaces from worldliness all the way through the cross and end at Heaven’s Gates. But beware. Do you have what you need to get into Heaven? Along the streets paved with gold, players will learn how to live a true Christian life. Players will need to think strategically as they meet up with temptations and worldliness, a simple roll of the dice can determine your fate. Will you roll one die or two? Which piece or card will you decide to take? Encounter the forgiveness of the Lord and rejoice will the blessings showered upon you. The Holy Spirit is your guide, helper and companion throughout the game. As you play you will: Experience excitement to draw your family and friends together; Progress along the books of the Bible; Draw cards to test your Bible knowledge; Be reminded of strategies for addressing temptations in your life; Learn the difference between the wisdom of God and the foolishness of the world
Realize the importance of having the Holy Spirit as your companion and helper.

The Road to Heaven Board Game design and game pieces are biblically based and include 3 sets of playing cards (Bible Book Cards, Blessing Cards and Knowledge Cards) and the following CUSTOM plastic pieces: 13 Lambs Book of Life pieces, 6 Crosses, 7 Earths, 6 Earth Stands, 6 Tips and Reminder Cards and 12 playing tokens in the shape of the Ichthys symbol or "Jesus fish" which are typically used to proclaim an affiliation with or affinity for Christianity.

Road to Heaven Board Game comes with a full size bible and has original art work. Both the cards and plastic pieces are made of higher quality than is required and standard. A minimum price of $39.95 plus tax per game was suggested by the manufacturer (plus shipping). It is priced to sell.

Road to Heaven Board Game is a fun, family-oriented, Bible focused board game designed to be as competitive and engaging as it is spiritually enriching. It is a game that will bring families together while at the same time teach all ages the books of the Bible and the scripture inside. You learn about the Bible in the midst of the ups and downs of the action.There is nothing comparable on the market that can provide a platform to learn the Bible in such a fun and exciting way! What an opportunity to outreach and introduce Jesus to unbelievers in a non-threatening way. You never know what will happen next. We pray and know that this game will have a positive impact on your life and that you have a great time playing it again and again.

Road to Heaven is a wholesome Christian game that’s fun AND meaningful. Road to Heaven teaches you how to live your life for Christ. Learn how even good things come out of bad things that happen along the Road to Heaven. This teaches that challenges you go through become opportunities for you to help others grow.

166397.name: Rat Hotel
166397.description:
User Summary

You play as a rat wandering around a hotel collecting cheese.

As you wander the hotel you must avoid the person named Waldo chasing you. If he catches you, you lose a life.

Your goal is to reach the big cheese in the middle of the bottom floor of the hotel.

166398.name: Elements of Power
166398.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are ancient and powerful beings in the archipelago, and many who call on that power in times of need. This series will deal with the source of that power and how it is used...

166399.name: Artifacts of the Archipelago: Iyanda's Prison
166399.description:
From publisher blurb:

“He was their leader, the worst of them and the best at the same time. Fierce, merciless and without compassion Iyanda’s name became synonymous with death. Even the bravest amongst the Uqtari trembled in his presence.”

Iyanda’s Prison

This artifact is the most legendary and sought after in the archipelago. Its appearance varies dependent on who is telling the story of the artifact and why. The location of Iyanda’s Prison is a total mystery and has fueled countless expeditions to the forgotten corners of the archipelago. Adventurers and scholars have spent their fortunes, and lives searching for it without success.

166400.name: People of the Archipelago: Uqtari
166400.description:
From publisher blurb:

Invaders, Reavers, and Raiders

In this product you will learn more about the Uqtari and why they are so hated by the other peoples of the archipelago.

Inside is an overview of the Uqtari for those who don't already have Nysilor-Archipelago of Ashes. Also included are hints and tips for using them in your adventures.

166401.name: Hefu-Ahte, Messenger of Souls
166401.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hefu-Ahte, Messenger of the Dead

Pierce the veil of mystery and learn the orgins of this enigmatic being. Learn of his place in the pantheon of the Archipelago of Ashes, and of his powers....

166402.name: Apulu-Onakai
166402.description:
From publisher blurb:

Apulu Onakai (Restless Demon) is the restless spirit of a murdered man or woman according to Angdesi legends.

This is one of the most feared supernatural entities of the Archipelago of Ashes, spirits that can possess others, appears in multiple forms, and relentless in the pursuit of their prey...

166403.name: Eskaja-Uqmali (Ashen Slayer)
166403.description:
From publisher blurb:

What is Known

The desolation of the old world created the first Eskaja-Uqmali. When the Three Cities fell under the rain of stones from the sky there were countless dead. Their corpses lay where they had fallen, decaying food for carrion eaters and looted by thieves. The first account of one of the Eskaja-Uqmali comes from a story originating from the ruins of Babala, one of the three great cities of the old world.

Welcome to the third Bestiary Focus Point.

Learn about the feared "Ashen Slayers" whose name is enough to terrorize the good people of the archipelago.

Inside is information that will help intergrate them into a campaign set in the archipelago, or your own game. This is a rules-agnostic version of the document using descriptors that can be easily translated to your favorite system.

166404.name: Onakai
166404.description:
From publisher blurb:

What is Known

Every culture has stories of devils and demons, evil personified that stalks the mortal world preying on its people. Onakai are the demons of the archipelago. They were unknown before the Atuang and many believe that they are the servants of the Gien, or Gien, called from whatever dark place the Summoning brought them from.

166405.name: Kotogawa: Emperor of Ash and Pearl
166405.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kotogawa is a new setting in the Coin Toss Games library. It is located NE of Nysilor, on the planet Uru. It is ruled by humans known as Jinteki. They are descended from marooned space/dimensional travelers, and cast out by the rest of humankind long ago.

This document contains a short introductory piece of fiction, and a glossary of terms.

166406.name: Scarab: Bulk Hauler
166406.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Scarab-class freighter is named for the squat, sturdy shape of its hull and its rugged endurance. It is just a coincidence that the original scarab is a species of “dung beetle” and this class of ship is often employed moving garbage and other unseemly cargos. The extended-hull version of the ship is known as the Kiboko-class, which is a Swahili word for hippo (a reference to its bulk and ungainly nature outside of the void). Both are cheap and dependable, though lacking in amenities. Each carries a crew of 2 to 12 and is designed to haul large quantities of everything from cargo crates, to shipping containers, to ore, trash, and even liquids like fuel or water.

The components built into these ships are about a decade behind “state of the art”. Using older designs and refurbished parts keeps the cost down but doesn’t produce a ship worth bragging about. Where the ship gets good marks is in durability. The hull is strong and well reinforced. This is necessary in order to haul dense cargo loads but also means the ship can withstand a lot of punishment. The older systems are also easy to maintain since any problems are well known and spare parts are plentiful. Lastly, the relative cost of these ships is low. That is, after all, the point. Both the Scarab-class and the Kiboko-class are unapologetically designed to get the job done, reliably, for the minimum price possible. These common ships are not much respected by ambitious independent pilots or status-conscious smugglers, but are very popular with companies and agencies that need a large number of cheap haulers.

The Scarab package contains four highly detailed, layered PDF files:

Main Book
20page PDF file detailing the ships, interior areas, and exo-frame cargo movers.
Contains several 3D rendered scenes as well as orthographic views of the ships.
Includes system independent statistics designed for easy adaption to your game of choice.
Background, art, and text are on different layers for custom display and printing.

Map Pages
21 page PDF file containing complete interior maps and instructions for assembly.
Miniature-scale maps for tactical combat with an optional 1 inch = 5 ft grid.
Divided into pages for easy printing in full color or printer-friendly black and white.
Selectable layers include: grid, black & white version, optional objects, and more.

2 Uncut Map Images
Two single page PDF files containing giant images of the complete deckplans.
The Scarab image is 24x36 inches; Kiboko 24x52.
Select either a light or dark background (for printing or projection/display).
Includes layers for grid, black & white version, optional objects, and background choice.





These ships are bulk haulers and much of their interior is dedicated to a single, cavernous hold. In a game setting the huge cargo hold could be used to store several ground vehicles or fighters instead of cargo, or could just be a great place to have a fight. The layered maps allow for the cargo to be shown or hidden – meaning you can have an empty hold or one crowded with palettes, crates, and barrels.

As always, this product is designed to give you ready-made ships to plug into your setting and rules of choice - lending depth and detail to your campaign. When it’s time to play, zero hour is ready!

rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
166407.name: Monsternomicon
rpghonor: 2015 ENnie for Best Art, Cover - Nominee
rpgissuearticle: Monsternomicon: Hollowed, Iron Maiden & Shaft Wight
166407.description:
From publisher blurb:

HERE BE MONSTERS: BEWARE.

In the Iron Kingdoms peril lurks at every turn, as fearsome and terrifying creatures both great and small look to turn unwary adventurers into their next meal or enslave them beyond death. From ferocious packs of ravenous burrow-mawgs to deadly ethereal pistol wraiths that haunt the back roads and forgotten cemeteries, the Monsternomicon is filled with creatures both mundane and supernatural to challenge even the most experienced adventuring parties.

This essential full-color guide to the wicked denizens of the Iron Kingdoms gives you everything you need to introduce them into your own adventures.

Features:

Rich, evocative background information and stats for over 40 monsters.
New creature templates for customizing your monsters to fit specific environments and themes.
Fully compatible with both the Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game and the upcoming Iron Kingdoms Unleashed Roleplaying Game.




DISCOVER WHAT LURKS IN THE SHADOWS!

166408.name: Arkadianax
166408.description:
Shoot your way though hordes of enemy ships, tanks, mine fields, wind mills, lazer beams, massive boss fights, planes and trains, all in a multi-dimensional shoot em up like never seen before!

As pilot of the "ARKADIANAX" face both 2D and 3D enemies blended into a whirlwind of nostalgic and modern gameplay, grab items and upgrade your beastly cannons to take down anything and everything that appears to be in your general shooting direction. Discover a colorful multi-dimensional world that requires your expert knowledge in arcade classics to protect and guard the universe; shoot bullets, bombs and massive fists of fury in this explosive space-age shmup!

Features:

- Single player and local coop campaign - Fight with friends!
- Password enabled save feature - Protect your save!
- Full controller support - Defend from the comfort of your couch!
- English and spanish language - Viva Nostalgia!
- More than 30 unique enemies
- Original 8 bit inspired music to motivate your journey
- Oh so many surprises- there's a decent chance you'll be surprised!

Source: The Developer Blog.

166409.name: Sheriff of Nottingham: Prince John's Sword Promo Card
166409.description:
Prince John's Sword is a single card worth 12 gold with a penalty of 6.

The promo came with Issue 176 October 2014 of Game Trade Magazine (GTM).

166410.description: Russian Railroads: Mini-Expansion, which might have a more precise title in the future, consists of four engineers, two factories/locomotives, and nine bonus tokens. In addition, it contains the two huts from the 2013 Stone Age: Casino expansion, thus making these tiles available on a larger scale.
166410.name: Russian Railroads: Mini-Expansion

166411.name: A Day At The Races
166411.description:
From publisher blurb:

On Your Marks!

Welcome to the races... Grab your mount or hop into your vehicle! Do you have what it takes to win? Can you snatch victory from the jaws of defeat? Perhaps most importantly, will you live up to the expectations of your adoring fans?

Take the Lead! Gain new fans! Earn more Coin, either through prize money or through effective betting!

A Day At The Races covers a new Dungeon World move for racing as well as 6 sub-moves and a few rules on how to handle betting on races.

166412.name: The Sewers One
166412.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sewers is a new geomorph style for Dungeons in Blue. Each tile in this collection has slimy and foul sewer lines running through it's corridors and chambers. Every dungeon needs sewers; where else are the doughty adventurers going to fill their quota of giant rat ears?

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility.

This product includes sixteen unique map tiles rendered at 100px per five-foot square. Each tile contains sewer lines and pools, and may also contain grand hallways and caverns, and cross-tile water features. The set includes two versions of each tile, one for players and one for GMs. The GM's version shows additional features, tricks, and traps. This set includes (SE1-SE16):

Four 50x50 foot tiles.
Eight 50x100 foot tiles.
Four 100x100 foot tiles.
A map legend image detailing all map markup.
A one-third scale summary map showing all tiles.
A short readme PDF.




All maps are ready-to-use PNG-format files compatible with most virtual tabletops. Use them as-is, or combine them into larger maps using your favorite image processing software.

166413.description: This is an expansion to Let Them Eat Shrimp and must be played with the base game. It consists of squid tiles and shark tokens. The squid tiles may be used to attack the shark, take shark tokens, and score points.
166413.name: Let Them Eat Shrimp: Shark v. Squid Expansion

166414.name: WWII Special Research Division
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
166414.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: WWII Special Research Division

World War II forced all powers to push their scientific understanding. The Special Research Division puts that new super science to the test in the field, teaming super soldiers up with spirit-walking shamans, ace snipers and gatormen (yes, gatormen) all under the command of a no-holds-barred commander!

166415.name: Freebie Pack 3
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
166415.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

Want to know more? No problem!

Cast of Cards: Freebie Pack 3 gives you five free NPCs. These unique characters fit in with other Cast of Cards decks, but are not repeats! If you like what you see, you'll have an extra card ready to go for your next adventure.

166416.name: Downhill OMG 2
166416.description:
User Summary

Downhill OMG 2 is a truly unique game. It is a mix of RPG, Infinite Terrain, Up-gradable Vehicles and Up-gradable skills. You, the player, will help Brent and his friends get everything he can from the Yeti's, while sledding insanely fast down the most unforgiving hill ranges in Antarctica.

166417.name: Realm of Perpetual Guilds
166417.description:
USer Summary

The story has four protagonists who go into dungeons, fight enemies, defeat bosses and level up. Will the protagonists simply fight respawning enemies for all of eternity? Or will they achieve greater things?

Features:

Free-turn Stamina Battle System
Full recovery after every battle.
Save at any time.
10 Classes to choose from at start of game
7 Challenging dungeons

166418.description:
