DESCRIPTION: Darkrock Ventures is a worker placement game about mining and exporting in a hostile outer space. Players will be controlling a mining company working in harsh conditions to acquire the most credits.

GENERAL INFO: A euro game for 1-5 players that plays in about 30-45 minutes.

THEME: Science Fiction. Space is a hostile environment with a known alien presence. Resources are scarce and it is commonplace for companies to mine asteroids to acquire them. It is known that aliens raid these asteroids and therefore mining companies are geared accordingly in preparation of being attacked. Lives are lost in this line of work daily, but if you run a good crew you can make it out alive and rich!

HOOK: Richly thematic euro incorporating dice and dice manipulation, with worker placement, resource farming and exporting.

WINNING CONDITION: Highest Credits when the end of the game is triggered. Credits are acquired primarily from exporting minerals mined from the asteroid.

MECHANICS: A round begins with rolling a set of Power Dice, these are community dice that players will use in order to successfully mine the asteroid. Players then take turns placing workers throughout different space stations and on a mineral rich asteroid.

After all the workers have been placed a third and more volatile Power Die is rolled. A player starts his/her turn by rolling his/her Rig Dice, these represent the a power element of his/her mining equipment that is to be paired with the community Power Dice in order to successfully mine resources from the asteroid. Then he/she resolves all his/her workers. As soon as players begin exporting minerals, hostile alien ships begin patrolling and will attack every round making it more difficult to resolve all the workers successfully.

Throughout the game, players will be increasing their worker count, gaining and spending credits (which are the victory points), gaining additional Rig Dice and acquiring explosive Neutronium bombs to protect them from the alien attacks.

When 3 of the 6 resource nodes on the asteroid are void of minerals the end of the game is triggered. The round is finished and the player with the most credits wins the game.

Darkrock Ventures will also include special 2-player game rules, as well as a Solo/Co-Operative variant.
166418.name: Darkrock Ventures
boardgamepodcastepisode: CnC First Impressions - DarkRock Ventures
CnC Interview - Ian Stedman Of Magic Meeple Games
Vox Republica 091: Arkham’s Finest - An Interview with Richard Launius
Vox Republica 092: Can I Make A Suggestion?

166419.description:
EXPAND YOUR COMMAND
Bolster your armies with Escalating Conflict, an 84-card expansion for WARMACHINE High Command Faith & Fortune! Escalating Conflict contains 5 copies each of 16 different cards, plus 4 additional warcaster cards, to bring new strategies to your Retribution of Scyrah, Convergence of Cyriss, Highborn Covenant, and Four Star Syndicate decks.

This set contains:

21 Retribution of Scyrah cards
21 Convergence of Cyriss cards
21 Highborn Covenant cards
21 Four Star Syndicate cards
1 Rule reference card
166419.name: Warmachine: High Command – Faith & Fortune: Escalating Conflict

166420.name: Cult of the Living Ice
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
166420.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Cult of the Living Ice

In the uttermost north is a land of ice and snow. Travellers there may find a freezing death waiting for them, or they may find a cult devoted to an arcane formation of living ice!

166421.name: The 13 Orphans
166421.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is part 1 of the Ancient Anger campaign for the role-playing game Operation: Fallen Reich.

The agents find themselves once again on the british countryside. A small community of black shirt fascists has settled down in the lovely hamlet of Dorexter and needs investigation. The agents can enjoy a garden fair, beautiful countryside and local theatre by the children of the Dorexter's Colonial Orphanage. But darker secrets and darker forces than black shirts are about to awaken in the woods surrounding the village. The 13 Orphans are the first part of the Ancient Anger campaign but can be played standalone..

166422.name: Secrets Best Kept Buried
166422.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is part 2 of the Ancient Anger campaign for the role-playing game Operation: Fallen Reich.

After the disturbing events of the missing orphans the agents are trying to relax at the Gorth family mansion. But wicked and ancient forces are set in play. Soon the agents will be thrown into a desperate fight to uncover well-hidden secrets and change the course of the future. This is the second adventure in the Ancient Anger campaign. It starts leisurely and then quickly turns darker. The agents will have to deal with an annoying future father in law, troublesome enemy agents and strange beings from beyond our reality all while their surroundings literary is falling apart.

(This scenario works best if “The 13 Orphans” has been played earlier, but not necessarily directly before it.)

166423.name: Conduit
166423.description:
From publisher blurb:

Amora Game Presents: Conduit base class (the Conduit is a part of our KS book Liber Influxus Communis set to release in Fall 2014)

Conduits possess a rare exceptional gift that is only shared by a few disparate creatures from the far-flung planes of existence, the ability to absorb magic. With this power, they are able to wield manifested magic, or even channel it into martial prowess while dispelling whatever magic their enemies might bring to bear upon them. They use terrifying counters that force energies directed at them, back towards their originators.

The conduit is an adaptable adventurer able to fulfill a number of different roles. Given his myriad array of abilities, a conduit might be a physical adept, a ranged powerhouse, a fast moving scout, or an extremely sly operator. He does require magic to function properly and, in low-fantasy settings, a conduit might find oneself at a great disadvantage compared to its counterparts.

This product includes: 10 pg PDF with Conduit base class, 3 feats, 2 archetypes.

166424.name: Harvest Mayhem
166424.description:
You are a farm owner at the end of the XIX Century, but in a pretty weird world, after weird experiments vegetables have come alive and crazy events can make your plan change in a second. Plant crops, buy animals, ghater resources, manufacture products, construct buildings, achieve missions and get those Victroy Points to Win.

There are 5 basic resources (tomato, raspberry, wood, wheat and Corn). You start the game drawing 5 resource cards from the Resource deck, drawing 1 Annual Mission (1 mission/place card and 2 mission/order cards) and drawing 1 Reward Card. Also you place your mini-gameboard in front of you. Resources pay everything, wood for buildings and different costs for Manufacture products and buying/feeding animals.

At the beginning of each season, you fulfill your hand till have 5 cards, but of course this are randomly drawed from Resource deck, and you cannot give it all to random cause you have only 4 season to complete "on time" your mission, and receive the bonus and a Reward card, and there is when Planting crops become important.

At the beginning of each year, each player receives a new annual mission by drawing a mission/place card and 2 mission/order mini-cards. To obtain the bonus specified by the mission/place card as well as a reward, both missions/orders must be completed in time (by the end of the year.).

Each Resource card have the "cost" of planting the crop in the upright corner (i.e Tomato have 2), so to plant, just place a resource card/crop on the table and discard the cards necessary from your hand. ONE token is then placed on the first blank space, in the next turn you place another token or harvest if ready (The crop is ready for harvest on the turn after the last token has been placed). The harvested crops represented by tokens are placed in their corresponding space in the barn, and the card return to your hand.

Each card lists the products that can be manufactured that resource. To manufacture simply pay the cost using either resource cards, and/or resources token stored in the barn, (the cards used go to the discard pile and tokens used are back to the token pile). Then place a token on its corresponding place on the shelve. You may manufacture as many products as desired (or posible) per turn.

There are 2 kinds of buildings in the game. Common buildings (Stables, Dairy, Henhouse, Sheep Yard), each player can build his own. And uniques buildings (Train Station, General Store, Inn, and Workshop).

The game ends after 12 rounds/seasons, after which the player with the highest amount of victory points wins. Victory points obtained during the game (by completing missions) are added to the points given by Resources, products and buildings.

rpgitemversion: Hurleurs Blancs Livre de Tribu PDF
166425.name: White Howlers Tribebook (W20)
166425.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Everyone knows the story of the White Howlers. Garou so prideful they threw themselves into the maw of the Wyrm, hoping to kill it from within. They didn't kill it, and it didn't kill them. However, the White Howlers should be remembered for their past as well as what they became.

But that isn't their story.

The White Howlers suffered through the Great Winter, through rebuilding and invasion, through an uneasy peace and a horrific war. They fought for their Kin and their lands. They were proud, but all Garou are proud. Theirs is a story too many Garou do not know. Come closer, and let me tell it.

White Howlers Tribebook includes:

The story of the White Howlers from the ancient times to their great sacrifice.
Details on the tribe's culture and history, with enough information to run an entire chronicle in the time before their fall.
Ideas for using the White Howlers in a story set in the modern nights.

166426.name: Tales of the Village
166426.description:
Publisher's description:

A Witch is not someone to be feared. Not someone who cooks children in the oven and sends a whole castle to sleep. Oh no.

Witches are there to help people, to solve those little and not-so-little problems in the village. But when those problems appear, will the witch be good enough to solve the problem? Only you can tell!

This RPG is designed for players of ages 7-12 or so, although anyone outside of those ages will also enjoy the game. It has been designed to ideally be run by someone with RPG experience but has very simple mechanics and is easily learned by anyone of any age.

This colour book contains full game rules for playing a Witch character as well as an introductory adventure. Future supplements will add additional character types, although there are enough options presented here to have several witches of different kinds adventuring together.

Simply requires some six sided dice!

166427.name: W.W.B: Trivia
166427.description: W.W.B Trivia was one of a number of games that was to go in the W.W.B Deluxe Set that never got published. It is a trivia game that added another element to W.W.B. In the game, players would have to answer a trivia question when they landed on a space, before they rolled the die to see if they stayed. If they answered wrong, they failed and went back to start. The trivia questions were basic math problems. Examples of the questions consisted of, when a player landed on the 1 space being asked what 1+0 was, and when landing on the 5 space being asked what 2+3 was.

166428.name: W.W.B: Deckbuilder
166428.description:
W.W.B: Deckbuilder was one of a number of games that was to go in the W.W.B Deluxe Set that never got published. It is a deckbuilding cardgame utilizing the cards from W.W.B.

In the game, the cards had different values from $1 to $25 dollars. Players started off with a single hand of 5 $1 cards. During their turn, they could buy one card from the available remaining cards that were left, put it in their discard pile with the cards in their hand and deal 5 more cards, reshuffling when their deck was empty. Play continued until all cards were gone. Player with the most expensive deck at the end of the game won.

166429.name: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire (Second Edition)
boardgameimplementation: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
boardgamefamily: TV Series: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire
166429.description:
In an almost identical format to its predecessor, players answer multiple-choice trivia questions of increasing difficulty, with the option of quitting with their winnings up to that point. This adaptation has makeshift versions of the TV show's "Ask the Audience" and "Phone a Friend" lifelines. Players rotate as host, and after everyone has taken a turn as host, winnings are totaled.

Based on the original ABC version of the world-famous game show, hosted by Regis Philbin from 1999-2002.

166430.name: Tekken Hybrid
166430.description:
User Summary

This is a collection of two arcade-style fighting games and the movie Tekken: Blood Vengeance. Included is an HD version of Tekken Tag Tournament and a demo of Tekken Tage Tournament 2.

166431.name: One Piece: Pirate Warriors 2
166431.description:
One Piece: Pirate Warriors 2 (ワンピース 海賊無双2 Wan Pīsu Kaizoku Musō Tsū) is an action game developed by Omega Force and published by Namco Bandai. It is the sequel to One Piece: Pirate Warriors. Due to the success of the first game, the sequel was released the year following. It was released in Europe on August 30, 2013 and in the U.S. on September 3, 2013.

The game no longer uses a canon story like the original. Instead it uses an original story that take place two years after the Straw Hats Pirates entered the New World. Battles have been changed to focus more on the warrior gameplay, and the player will have to fight through higher numbers of enemies than the previous game. The quick time events from the first game has been removed completely. The game also features a coin system, in which players can spend the money they earn from stages to level up new characters quickly, instead of training them from level 1.

One noticeable change from the previous game is how support is handled. Players can build up a support gauge throughout gameplay, and use it to go into "Haki mode". When in this mode they have the option of temporarily switching characters, and playing as the new character until the support gauge runs out. Haki mode also gives a different benefit depending on the characters used: "Armament" characters do more damage when attacking, while "Observation" characters effectively slow down time, while retaining their normal speed.

Source: Wikipedia, "One Piece: Pirate Warriors 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

166432.name: Hot Wheels: World's Best Driver
videogameversion: Norht America Nintendo Wii U physical edition
166432.description:
Gear up for the most intense challenges only Hot Wheels® can deliver! Pick your team, choose your ride and go for it!

Get behind the wheel of thrilling Hot Wheels vehicles while joining the elite ranks of Team Hot Wheels™. Compete in dozens of unique, fast-paced, re-playable challenges all highlighting the different driving styles of Team Hot Wheels: the speed record-breaking Green Team, the show-stopping stunts of the Red Team, the high-tech precision of the Blue Team and the world record-breaking jumps of the Yellow Team.

Do you have what it takes to be the World's Best Driver?

Game Features:
Customize 24 iconic Hot Wheels® vehicles!
Test your skills in 50+ challenges across 4 Hot Wheels Test Facilities™.
Play with up to 4 friends locally.

Source: The Publisher Website.

166433.name: Hot Wheels: Track Attack
166433.description:
Hot Wheels Track Attack is an arcade-style racing video game, developed by Firebrand Games, and published by THQ. It was released in North America on November 23, 2010 for Wii and Nintendo DS.

The gameplay of Hot Wheels Track Attack revolves around the player racing a Hot Wheels car in a variety of events in order to unlock new cars, tracks and events. Players start with a small section of cars to race with and a limited number of events to compete in, but as players progress though the game, and earn medals for completing events, they unlock new cars, tracks, and events. Every race track in the game has blue tokens scattered throughout it, players collect these tokens by driving over them and can use them to buy additional upgrades for their cars. The in-game race tracks are filled with elements, such as ramps, loops, and obstacles that are made to resemble actual Hot Wheels toys.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hot Wheels Track Attack", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

166434.name: 2 Games In 1 Double Pack - Hot Wheels: World Race / Velocity X
videogameversion: North America Game Boy Advance physical edition
166434.description:
User Summary

Contains the games Hot Wheels: Velocity X and Hot Wheels: World Race.

166435.name: Pirate's Island: The Escape
166435.description:
Can you escape from the Pirate's Island?
Words are out about the Royal Navy's discovery of the Pirate's Island. Their arrival is imminent in 12 days.
You are pirates and you must organize your escape before the Royal Navy catches up on you!
In order to escape, are you ready to conspire with corsairs in the Island's tavern, acquire the necessary booty from the black market and hire skillful crew?
Don't forget that you have to use your wits and discover areas of the island forgotten by its residents! You may even have to setup an ambush in the island's bridge along with "Goldtooth"...
How far are you willing to go?

GAMEPLAY:
Players alternate turns placing Pirates and Deckhands on locations of the board, that they think will help them advance strategically, taking accordingly, gear, allies, supplies or dubloons. Several locations are available in the beginning of the game, but new locations may be discovered later during the game.
After all players are done placing Pirates and Deckhands on the board, an event card is revealed that may affect players.
When the event is resolved, Pirates and Deckhands are removed from the board and returned next to the player's mats. We've squeezed out of this day as much as we could. Time to rest.

Greek description:

Αποδράστε γρήγορα από το Νησί των Πειρατών!
Οι πληροφορίες λένε ότι το Βασιλικό Ναυτικό ανακάλυψε το Νησί των Πειρατών και θα είναι εκεί σε 12 μέρες.
Είστε πειρατές και πρέπει να οργανώσετε την απόδρασή σας πριν το Βασιλικό Ναυτικό σας προλάβει!
Για να αποδράσετε, είστε έτοιμοι να συνωμοτήσετε με κουρσάρους στην ταβέρνα του νησιού, να αποκτήσετε τα απαραίτητα τιμαλφή από τη μαύρη αγορά και να προσλάβετε ικανό πλήρωμα;
Μην ξεχνάτε ότι θα πρέπει να χρησιμοποιήσετε την εξυπνάδα σας και να ανακαλύψετε περιοχές στο νησί, ξεχασμένες από τους κατοίκους του! Ίσως και να χρειαστεί να στήσετε ενέδρα στην Γέφυρα του νησιού μαζί με τον «Χρυσοδόντη»…
Εσείς όμως μέχρι πού είστε ικανοί να φτάσετε;

ΤΡΟΠΟΣ ΠΑΙΞΙΜΑΤΟΣ:
Οι παίκτες στην σειρά τους τοποθετούν Πειρατές ή Μούτσους στο ταμπλό, σε περιοχές που πιστεύουν ότι θα τους βοηθήσουν να αναπτυχθούν στρατηγικά, παίρνοντας ανάλογα με την θέση τους, εξοπλισμούς, συμμάχους, προμήθειες ή δουβλόνια. Αρκετές τοποθεσίες είναι διαθέσιμες στην αρχή του παιχνιδιού, αλλά νέες περιοχές μπορεί να ανακαλυφθούν αργότερα στο παιχνίδι.
Όταν όλοι οι παίκτες έχουν ολοκληρώσει την τοποθέτηση Πειρατών και Μούτσων στο ταμπλό, αποκαλύπτεται ένα γεγονός, το οποίο μπορεί να επηρεάσει τους παίκτες.
Αφού ολοκληρωθεί το γεγονός, οι παίκτες μαζεύουν τους Πειρατές και τους Μούτσους από το ταμπλό και τους επιστρέφουν δίπλα στην καρτέλα τους. Είναι το τέλος της ημέρας και είναι ώρα για ξεκούραση.

166436.description:
In Flanders Field takes the player to the very heart of what it would have been like to be a CO in the trenches of Flanders. At every move you must make decisions that will determine the fate of the men you command. Your troops must face bombardment from the enemy's artillery, tanks and aeroplanes. How many men will you risk on a particular course of action?

A game for 2-4 players where you take a role as a British Company Commander attempting to be the first to reach the "Objective Line". You start from your own trench and must advance across "No Man's Land" while trying to limit your casualties. It's a "push your luck" game where you roll dice and play cards matching the roll, after which you can decide to try to advance further, or stop and carry out card actions. Pushing too far could incur heavy losses.
166436.name: In Flanders Field
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ72: In Flanders Field (2014) Martin Wallace

166437.name: Grandpa's Chest
166437.description:
Grandpa owns an old chest, like no other!
"Things go in, things come out, its like a show!
Can you or can you not, tell them all, in a row?"
What happens when Granny and the Cheeky Monkey enter the game? It all becomes harder and you must seek help from Charlie, Betty and the Thief. But is their help enough?

A fun card game full of laughter for friends and family.

Players alternate turns placing object cards in a chest, face down. Each player during his/her turn must name all the objects that were placed in the chest from previous turns.

Greek description:
Ο Κυρ Γιάννης είναι ο ιδιοκτήτης ενός παλιού μπαούλου, που... δε μοιάζει με τα άλλα!
"Πράγματα μπαίνουν, πράγματα βγαίνουν γρήγορα και βιαστικά!
Άραγε, θα μπορείς να τα θυμάσαι όλα στη σειρά;"
Τι γίνεται όμως, όταν στο παιχνίδι μπαίνει η Θεία Λένα και η Ανακατώστρα Μαϊμού; Τότε όλα δυσκολεύουν και ελπίζεις στη βοήθεια του Λευτεράκη, της Βασούλας και του Κλέφτη!
Είναι ομως αρκετή;
Ένα διασκεδαστικό παιχνίδι με κάρτες που θα προσφέρει αξέχαστες στιγμές γέλιου σε όλη την παρέα!

Οι παίκτες τοποθετούν κάρτες αντικειμένων σε ένα μπαούλο κλειστές. Κάθε παίκτης στην σειρά του πρέπει να πει όλα τα αντικείμενα που έχουν ήδη τοποθετηθεί στο μπαούλο.

166438.name: Kazamata (Issue 1 - Dec 2012)
166438.description: The first issue of the Hungarian fanzine, Kazamata.

166439.name: Kazamata (Issue 2 - Jul 2013)
166439.description: The second issue of the Hungarian fanzine, Kazamata.

166440.name: Sblap
166440.description:
Creatures from outer space have arrived on Earth and they want to communicate with us, but they need to learn our language.

With Sblap, you have to say words so that the aliens can learn to communicate. This game requires speed, a sharp eye, creativity and memory. Is so appropriate to train memory, attention and creativity capacities and also communication and social skills needed in any social context.

1. Deal all the cards among the players more or less evenly. It doesn't matter if a given player receives an extra card.

2. Each player will form a stack of cards in front of him/her. Cards must be placed face down so that no one can see them.

3. The player with the strangest face begins, by taking a card and placing it face up in the middle of the table, within reach of all the players. Clockwise, each player will take a card and place it in the central stack. The moment two cards showing the same alien or the same letter coincide, any player can cover the central stack with his/her hand and the fastest in doing so must shout out a word beginning with the letter on the covered card.

Then, he/she must take all the cards from the central stack and, mockingly, distribute them how he/she chooses among the remaining players. This player will place a new card in the central deck to continue the game. The cards that players receive are incorporated to their stack of cards at the bottom.

4. The game continues in the same way: the moment two aliens or letters coincide again, any player can cover the central stack with his/her hand and, at that moment, he/she must shout out the preceding word and add a new one beginning with the letter on the card that he/she has just been covered.

Progressively, a word sequence will be formed that must be memorized. If a mistake is made while shouting out the word sequence or if a word is invalid because of a spelling mistake or if he/she has covered the central deck when two cards do not match, the player receives the central stack of cards and places a new card in the central deck to continue the game. The existing word sequence is eliminated and begins to reform.

5. The first player to get rid of all of his/her cards wins the game.
Variations of the game: play using not just real words but also words in other languages, invented words or sounds.

166441.name: High Velocity Bowling
166441.description:
From Wikipedia,

High Velocity Bowling varies from other bowling games by introducing a challenge mode. The player has to go through every level to unlock all of the 10 playable characters and all of the 10 lanes. Each level has 3 challenges to complete. These challenges can be tournaments, matches or trick shots, where the objective is to get a strike while following a certain road. The game also has a trophy room, in which the player can see his trophies, rings and patches he gained through the game. While the player can use the Sixaxis for the bowling swing, there are other control schemes in the game as well as Playstation Move support on the Blu-ray release. Finally, High Velocity Bowling has a multiplayer mode, where up to 4 people can play online and offline.

Source: Wikipedia, "High Velocity Bowling", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

166442.name: Elevator Action Deluxe
166442.description:
User Summary

The legendary arcade game from 1983 returns with an HD makeover. You're a legendary super spy! Your mission: break in at the roof, work your way down the floors of the buildings, steal top–secret documents, and escape. But this isn’t the same game you remember from the arcades. New bad guys, new traps, and new challenges all await you. Are you good enough to survive the dangers that await in ELEVATOR ACTION DELUXE? More challenges, more characters, and more fun! There's also a local multiplayer mode that lets four players play simultaneously. And, as a bonus, it also contains the arcade original ELEVATOR ACTION for your retro enjoyment.

166443.name: Sing it!
166443.description:
Are you ready for our grand lyrics competition?

In the party game Sing it!, players draw a card, choose a word, and say the lyrics of the first song that comes to mind. Beat your opponents before the time ends!

Sing it! contains rules for a half-dozen games along with 488 words.
_________________________________________________________________

Sing it! Ένα παιχνίδι που όταν το παίξεις θα πεις και ένα τραγούδι…

488 ελληνικές λέξεις, 6 προκλήσεις,
όλα τα είδη μουσικής, 1 μεγάλος νικητής…

Είσαι έτοιμος για την απόλυτη τραγουδιστική μονομαχία;
Σήκωσε την κάρτα, δες τη λέξη, πες γρήγορα το τραγούδι που σου έρχεται στο μυαλό και πρόλαβε τους αντιπάλους σου πριν τελειώσει ο χρόνος!
Αυστηρώς κατάλληλο με συνταγή παιχνιδογνώστη για:

όσους έχουν καλή φωνή
όσους έχουν κάλο στη φωνή και
παρέες με γείτονες που εκτιμούν το ταλέντο!

166445.name: ΚΥΒΟΛΕΞΟ
166445.description:
A word game with a timer. Players roll 20 dice with letters and according values on them, in order to form words with the highest values.

Ένα παιχνίδι ευστροφίας, αντίληψης και… ταχύτητας!
Άδειασε τα 20 κυβάκια με τα γράμματα στο τραπέζι, γύρισε την κλεψύδρα και γρήγορα, πριν τελειώσει ο χρόνος, σχημάτισε όσες πιο πολλές ελληνικές λέξεις μπορείς! Σημείωσε τη βαθμολογία σου στο μπλοκ και… δες αν είσαι εσύ ο μεγάλος νικητής!

166448.name: Goal Quiz
166448.description:
A Trivia Game about football. Players wager on 1 of 4 possible answers to questions and pass the ball on a football field in order to score. Action cards provide effects based on known football terms like off-side and corner.

Ένα παιχνίδι αφιερωμένο στους μικρούς και μεγάλους λάτρεις του ποδοσφαίρου, του πιο δημοφιλούς αθλήματος στον κόσμο!
Ο αγώνας ξεκινά! Είσαι έτοιμος να αντιμετωπίσεις την αντίπαλη ομάδα σε έναν συναρπαστικό αγώνα γνώσεων, γκολ και… πολλών ανατροπών; Τότε φόρα τη φανέλα, τα αθλητικά σου παπούτσια και μπες στο γήπεδο δυναμικά! Η κερκίδα σε στηρίζει και δεν έχεις να φοβηθείς τίποτα. Πόνταρε λοιπόν, στη σωστή απάντηση, χρησιμοποίησε τις κάρτες Ενεργειών, κλέψε, κάνε πάσα και βγες μπροστά για το πολυπόθητο γκολάκι!
2200 ερωτήσεις από ΟΛΕΣ τις διοργανώσεις του κόσμου σε περιμένουν…

166449.name: Kontesa: il libro e la spada
166449.description:
This game allow you to discover the history, traditions and folklore of an italian province, answering to many question regarding 6 big themes (history, curiosity, geography, etc..) and gaining control of areas in the map, scoring points that will lead you to victory.

A correct answer allow you to put a meeple in an area, and to draw a card that can help you during the game. During established turns in the game you will verify who control the areas, and score point accordingly.

There are many version of this game, regarding many province: Bergamo (first version), Brescia, Brianza, Padova, Treviso, Venezia, Verona, Vicenza.

166450.name: Deksport
166450.description:
From publisher blurb:

Huddled behind an ancient breakwater of unknown provenance and hemmed in by dense woodlands, the pirate stronghold of Deksport is an isolated, violent place. Orcs and goblins openly walk the streets among the human inhabitants and serve on the many predatory vessels sailing from the port. Built upon the ruins of an old logging town swept away long ago in a tide of blood and slaughter great quantities of loot, treasure and slaves flows through the dilapidated, ruined port. Ruled by a loose coalition of three powerful, vicious and depraved co-rulers, Deksport is a nest of suffering, self-interest and barely restrained racial violence. Each of the three co-rulers plots ceaselessly against their peers, working to become the undisputed lord of the pirates and thus the town perpetually teeters on the edge of bloodshed and chaos. With nearby kingdoms growing increasingly angry with the pirates’ depredations, the call has gone out for brave adventurers to crush the pirate threat once and for all.

Town Backdrops are short, richly detailed supplements that each present a single town ready to insert into almost any home campaign. Perfect for use as a waystop on the road to adventure, as an adventure site themselves or as a PC’s home, Town Backdrop present the details so the busy GM can focus on crafting exciting, compelling adventures.

166451.name: Hot Wheels: All Out
videogameversion: European Game Boy Advance physical edition
North America Game Boy Advance physical edition
166451.description:
back of box

Climb into the drivers seat, slam it into drive, and go! Choose one of eight sleek 2006 Hot Wheels cars, pick your location, and squeal the tires as you race for the checkered flag. Seven different modes to choose from, including Collector, Time Attack, Pursuit, Eliminator, and Ultimate Challenge. Take the Challenge today!

166452.name: You're Gonna Die Screaming
166452.description:
From publisher blurb:

You're Gonna Die Screaming, the Optimization Guide for Commoners

You're Gonna Die Screaming, the Optimization Guide to Commoners shows you how to take this NPC class out of the background and put it at the forefront of your game by helping players make the most out of commoner characters.

As an optimization guide, You're Gonna Die Screaming shows you the highs and lows of the choices you make while building a commoner character. Knowing which race gives you the most, best helpful abilities from the start, which abilities to favor, and which skills and feats will give you the most mileage all improve your commoner's chances of survival.

But, with proper optimization, your commoner's won't just survive. They can actually thrive!

Your choices are color coded, based upon the author's explanations and opinions, to show you how best to optimize your commoner character.

166453.name: Tadpole Gunship
166453.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The small craft introduced in this installment of the series is a 200 dT gun and dropship, ideal for hot drop zones.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

166454.name: Hot Wheels: Burnin' Rubber
videogameversion: Europe Game Boy Advance physical edition
US Game Boy Advance physical edition
166454.description:
Back of box

Start your engines and race for the championship in your favoritie Hot Wheels cars as they fly over jumps, careen around hairpin turns and speed through radical environments!

166455.name: I SPY Original
166455.description:
I SPY Original is a memory game based on the I Spy line of classic children's books and the photographs of Walter Wick and Jean Marzollo. The catch is that the images aren't exact matches. Instead, one version may be a silhouette or from another angle. According to the instructions, recognizing an object in a different environment is a valuable pre-reading skill.

Several variants are included in I SPY Original.

166456.name: End of Line
166456.description:
From publisher blurb:

Living in the digital age can be difficult for anyone, even more so if you’re just a lowly program. After the defeat of the MCP, the party is betrayed by Hack, who immediately steals the MCP disc and escapes to the net. The party must chase and capture Hack before the grid goes off line; without the MCP’s algorithms, however, they must pray to their users for strength. The players themselves will have to intervene at the game table in order to help their programs and catch Hack before the next cycle. Will the users and programs succeed, or will they face the End of Line?

From Episode 24 - Zombie-Tron

Description: The Gagmen host a guest, Adam Baillio, for his Kickstarter for making custom LED light up costumes. The adventure is a digital fantasy (you know, like Tron) and the Gagmen give it a pretty good go. Unfortunately it was right back to a zombie horror game, but we got to have a lot of fun with it. Also, enjoy a side dish of meta-gaming with user controls in the form of a hat.

166457.name: 54 Aberrations & Magical Beasts (Blank-backed)
166457.description:
From publisher blurb:

54 creatures on 54 cards! Plus a cover/checklist card. The front of each has amazing art, while the back is blank with lines for you to make your own notes.

166458.name: 54 Humanoids & Monstrous Humanoids (Blank-backed)
166458.description:
From publisher blurb:

54 creatures on 54 cards! Plus a cover/checklist card. The front of each has amazing art, while the back is blank with lines for you to make your own notes.

166459.name: 54 Fey, Constructs & Wildlife (Blank-backed)
166459.description:
From publisher blurb:

54 creatures on 54 cards! Plus a cover/checklist card. The front of each has amazing art, while the back is blank with lines for you to make your own notes.

166460.name: 54 Dragons, Undead & Outsiders (Blank-backed)
166460.description:
From publisher blurb:

54 creatures on 54 cards! Plus a cover/checklist card. The front of each has amazing art, while the back is blank with lines for you to make your own notes.

166461.name: 54 Animals & Vermin (Blank-backed)
166461.description:
From publisher blurb:

54 creatures on 54 cards! Plus a cover/checklist card. The front of each has amazing art, while the back is blank with lines for you to make your own notes.

166462.description: Samurai Spirit: The 8th Boss is a single card mini-expansion for Samurai Spirit that can be shuffled with the "6-value" boss cards in the base game. When this card lies in the combat line to the right of a samurai's board at the start of his turn, the players sitting to his left and right must draw a Raider card, add it to their combat line, and modify their battle track accordingly.
166462.name: Samurai Spirit: The 8th Boss

166463.description: Agricola: France Deck is a theme deck for Agricola of 120 occupation and minor improvement cards that are all related to the history, culture, politics, sports and science of France.
166463.name: Agricola: France Deck

166464.description:
The Spellcaster: Spiel 2014 Promo Pack is a promotional pack of cards available at Spiel 2014 to those who purchase the base game.
It consists of 4 cards (1 of each color).
166464.name: Spellcaster: Spiel 2014 Promo Pack

166465.name: Clan of the Pig
166465.description:
From publisher blurb:

Real orcs have snouts

Inspired by old-school illustrations that depict orcs as pig-like creatures, Animal Races: Clan of the Pig presents customizable racial traits for orcs and half-orcs with porcine features, plus numerous options that take orcs in entirely new directions, from orcs that resemble hippopotamuses to orcs with infernal blood.

Also included: An original take on orc society and culture; an orc deity with ties to the Wild Hunt of the fey; a feat for orc and half-orc withes who want to follow in the footsteps of Grendel's mother; and numerous other details one can use to flesh out an orc or half-orc character.

166466.name: Bankgammon
166466.description: Monopoly type game. Unique three section game board fits together like puzzle pieces so that a standard sized board can fit in this small box without folding. Game comes with4 wooden game pieces, dice, Bankgammon money in 50's and 100's, banking slips, fortune cards, instructions and game board. Info on game comes from description on EBAY sale 9/25/14

166467.name: Pax Demonica
166467.description:
From publisher blurb:

What do your heroes do when a war starts among the under ground mobs and nightmare creatures of the city’s supernatural criminals? Find out and live the excitement with this great new adventure for Heroes Wear Masks.

166468.name: Hot Wheels: Stunt Track Challenge
videogameversion: North America Game Boy Advance physical edition
videogamecompilation: Hot Wheels: Stunt Track Challenge / Hot Wheels: World Race
166468.description:
Hot Wheels: Stunt Track Challenge is a video game published by THQ. It was released on November 9, 2004 and appeared on PlayStation 2, Game Boy Advance, and Windows. It is a stuntman game show that consists of drivers competing in death-defying stunt challenges and win fast races to stay on the show. Sometimes, you will get to play mini games with special tasks, usually involving collecting icons in a limited amount of time. Races take place on one of 12 tracks,and players compete to finish first. The game's 24 stunt challenges reward players for performing daring deeds from the controller. The game also has an online mode for playing all of these game-modes. The online is hosted by GameSpy and is still in service.

A sequel to this game, entitled Hot Wheels: All Out, was released for Game Boy Advance in 2006.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hot Wheels: Stunt Track Challenge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

166469.name: Hot Wheels: Stunt Track Challenge / Hot Wheels: World Race
videogameversion: North America Game Boy Advance physical edition
166469.description:
User Summary

Contains the games Hot Wheels: Stunt Track Challenge and Hot Wheels: World Race.

166470.name: Silverhex Chronicles
166470.description:
User Summary

The Silverhex Chronicles is a collection of six linked short quests, designed to be played as part of Pathfinder Society organized play. While they form a single story, the party can choose to pursue them in any order (although one is a clear finale).

166471.name: Apptivity Hot Wheels
166471.description:
Download the app to your iPad, and race awesome cars across your tablet screen to explore the top-secret
Hot Wheels Test Facility™!

Choose from 4 different vehicles, each with unique in-game sounds, handling and augmentations—Power Rev™, Bone Shaker™, Yur So Fast™ and Drift King™!
Explore 9 action-packed racing, jumping and shooting challenges within the hangars of the Hot Wheels Test Facility™.
Earn awesome vehicle upgrades to customize and enhance your experience.

Source: The Publisher Website.

166472.description:
First expansion to Flippin' Fruit.

The Tropical Expansion includes:

16 NEW Smoothie cards
4 NEW Fruit Basket cards
1 Tropical Fruit Die
166472.name: Flippin' Fruit: Tropical Expansion

166473.description:
Make deals, lay tracks, and build a national high speed rail system! When it's your turn to lay new track, you'll ask the other players for proposals and pick one to implement.

Cards represent different regions and industries in the U.S. You represent three of them. Two are public for the other players to see, the third, well, that's your hidden agenda! To win, you'll want to satisfy at least two of your three.

Rules are 1 page long. Game takes approximately 60 minutes for a 3-6 player game, and 30 minutes for two players. Game is downloadable as a print and play from the official website.
166473.name: US High Speed Rail

166474.name: Shadow Spells
166474.description:
From the Publishers website:
The Universe of Magic

Magic cannot be contained or easily defined. It can barely be controlled. It is large, omnipresent, and multi-faceted. It contains multitudes.

A few of those multitudes are in this book, such as Pierre Dubois, media personality and Psionist researcher; a band of fortune seekers known as Treasure Hunters, Inc.; strange crystalline entities who may be forming a dangerous alliance; a spell to turn an unfortunate victim’s blood into a sludgy mess; and an adept power that temporarily blanks out memory, making an individual immune to interrogation.

These and more are here—spells, adept powers, rituals, and a host of magical knowledge. It may be a single meter would compared to the nigh-infinite length of the full scroll of magical knowledge, but as any shadowrunner can tell you, in a pinch a meter can make all the difference in the world.

Shadow Spells is for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition.

166475.description: No time to go fishing? No problem: Fish'n'Stones brings the pond to you! Fun and fishing passion are at the forefront in this lively fishing game that promotes strategic thinking, memory, and observation skills. The chances here are high that everyone makes a catch!
166475.name: Fish'n'Stones

166476.name: Tunse'al Player's Guide (Savage Worlds)
166476.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the Tunse'al Player's Guide for Savage Worlds. Your game table needs both a Savage Worlds rules book (SW:EX or SWD) and Tunse'al Setting Guide for Savage Worlds. There is a second version (Systemless) that works with the systemless setting guide for use with whatever system you choose.

The player's guide is excerpted from the full setting guide. It is not required for playing Tunse'al campaigns. However, having a copy means you don't have to wait for the GM to be done with her book for you to look up whatever was on your mind.

This PDF contains a variety of information pertinent to character creation. You'll find Racial Background Edges, new Hindrances specific to Tunse'al, tribal details, an overview of the gods, select information about the lands, a map, and even a blank character sheet.

166477.name: Tunse'al Player's Guide (Systemless)
166477.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the Systemless Tunse'al Player's Guide for any system. Your game table needs both a system rule book of the GM's choice and Tunse'al Setting Guide, Systemless. There is a second version for Savage Worlds if you have the Savage Worlds rule book and would rather not deal with the work it takes to use the conversion system with the Systemless titles.

The player's guide is excerpted from the full setting guide. It is not required for playing Tunse'al campaigns. However, having a copy means you don't have to wait for the GM to be done with her book for you to look up whatever was on your mind.

This PDF contains a variety of information pertinent to character creation. You'll find the mechanical pieces to apply traits, skills, and other elements of character creation including races, drawbacks and advantages that are specific to Tunse'al, tribal details, an overview of the gods, select information about the lands, a map, and even a blank character sheet.

166478.name: Tunse'al Setting Guide (Systemless)
166478.description:
From publisher blurb:

This version of the Tunse'al Setting Guide is systemless: It does not contain any rules. However, there are tables to help you translate the setting information to whatever game system you choose.

Play in a world where technology is slow to advance, tribes are divided by great geographical expanses, trade is fraught with peril, dinosuar-like beasts co-exist with people, and the very environment poses danger to your party. Tunse'al is a tribal, fantasy setting with four playable races that are outside the norm.

The swamp-dwelling Kresh are an amphibious, genderless race committed to ensuring their sacred land, The Wetlands, and as much of Tunse'al as they can protect is safe from greedy destruction. The cold-enduring Gelid use their pathfinding ways throughout the long stretches of the Baarek Mountains to explore and make peace wherever possible. The towering, red-skinned, two-horned Korrin pursue all things with passion in their free-form society of The Footlands where families don't conform to any set parameters. The thick-skinned, nomadic Gales with eyes resembling a snake's wander The Drylands in search of desert gems, tar, and other commodities no one else would have any hope obtaining.

The Skin Eaters of The Dreamlands round out the dominant races, although they are only at the GM's disposal. They are the treacherous, twisted cousins to the Kresh. In her madness, their creator, Sa'ra, decided to pay back her brothers for an earlier wrong, making the Skin Eaters dependent upon others' skins in order to live. They are not mindless, but no tribe trusts them as historical attempts to have a respectable relationship have always ended in bloodshed. Then there is the prophecy that they will one day convert the Kresh to their cause to conquer the other Tunse'als in honor of Sa'ra's predicted awakening. That hasn't helped anyone want to sign-up to be there best friends.

The book contains an wide array of world information with detailed descriptions of each land's properties, the history of the peoples, character creation information with each race's parameters, a cross-section of beasts and fae that would be found throughout the vast land, a map, ten pre-generated characters, and a blank character sheet. It does not include a campaign, but does give ideas of what could be done with Tunse'al.

166479.name: Tunse'al Quick Starts and Side Tracks (Systemless)
166479.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is Tunse'al Quick Starts and Side Tracks, Systemless. While it is not a "quick start rules" product, it can be used in a similar fashion if you just want an idea of what Tunse'al is without first buying the Tunse'al Setting Guide. All Tunse'al products are made in a second, systemless version, too.

Tunse'al Quick Starts and Side Tracks is best used with the Tunse'al Setting Guide and whatever system's rules you prefer as it's intended as a GM aid.

This PDF contains:

an encapsulated view of the world
six Quick Starts scenarios to help you get quickly started in creating your own Tunse’al campaign; most are designed with low level or somewhat inexperienced characters in mind, which is easily altered to your needs
ten Side Tracks meant to give you something to pull out quickly when you need to fill in gaps, stretch out a session, or even just for use as an adventure seed to improvise from
four pre-generated characters
a map of Tunse'al

166480.description:
The Mob Town City Limits Expansion adds additional Landmarks, Professionals, and City Cards. It also adds a new set of cards called "Breaking News" which introduces a new element to each round, specifically in the last 10 cards of the draw deck.

Includes:
10 Breaking News cards
18 Landmark Cards:

Horseshoe Saloon
Medieval Feasts Dinner Theater
Gamer's Grind Gaming Café

Milton Moleagins

166480.name: Mob Town: City Limits Expansion

166481.name: Savage Insider (Volume 2, Issue 1 - Summer 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Expanded Mechanics: Why Stop at Guts?
Game Prep: From Zero to Hero
General Interest: Thinking Outside the Table
Great Adventures: Suffer Not the Little Children
Mechanics Wise: Black and White 60s Spy Show
Special Address : State of the Savage
Stories to Inspire: Hearts and Minds
166481.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue of Savage Insider marks the debut of Volume 2, now published by Obatron Productions. We're passionate about Savage Worlds and want to share that with you. Originally envisioned as a 48-page issue, our new format garnered an overwhelming response, allowing us to increase the size by more than 50%. The theme is Rebirth and Reinvention, and it is threaded throughout all the pieces, which can be used across genres.

What's in It for You

A Special Address from Clint Black on Behalf of Pinnacle Entertainment Group
Two Great Adventures + a Surveyed (between the three you get multiple maps and THREE pages of minis)
Two Features on Mechanics
Other Returning Favorites: Designer's Diary, Game Prep, Character Gallery, Equipment Corral
Exclusive First Appearances
Two Discounts: A $5 coupon from Pinnacle Entertainment Group and 33% discount from StoryWeaver
Information on Recent Releases and Upcoming Releases, plus Convention Connection
Lower Percentage of Advertisements Than Most Popular Magazines
Live Links from Table of Contents and Text

166482.name: Savage Insider (Issue 10 - Apr 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Equipment Corral: Lash of the Master, Pavor Unum, & Spear of Uldearium
Great Adventure: Once and Once and a Long Time Ago
166482.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy; the world’s most popular genre. Warriors clash, wizards blast with arcane powers, and rogues sneak behind to stab in the back or steal what they can. This is where tabletop role-playing began, and this is where Savage Insider brings it back to. In the latest issue of Savage Insider, we bring to you the epic-nature of fantasy in Make it Epic.

Savage Insider #10: Make it Epic is all about fantasy! This issue brings many aspects of the fantasy genre from adventures that cross forests, filled with random encounters (the Great Adventure, Once and Once and a Long Time Ago), to investigating the goings-on within a city (in the latest Surveyed article), and into the depths of a large crypt (the Random Encounter, Dogs of War). Grab your swords and staves and prepare to defend your realm!

Savage Insider #10: Make it Epic includes:

A brand new, full-length Great Adventure.
Series of fantasy encounters for DramaScape’s The Crypt battlemap.
A look at the ranger fantasy archetype.
What it means to create your own pantheon.
An article about power trappings.
Magical weapons.
… and more!

166483.name: The Sewers Two
166483.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sewers is a new geomorph style for Dungeons in Blue. Each tile in this collection has slimy and foul sewer lines running through it's corridors and chambers. Every dungeon needs sewers; where else are the doughty adventurers going to fill their quota of giant rat ears?

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility.

This product includes twenty-four unique map tiles rendered at 100px per five-foot square. Each tile contains sewer lines and pools, and may also contain grand hallways and caverns, and cross-tile water features. The set includes two versions of each tile, one for players and one for GMs. The GM's version shows additional features, tricks, and traps. This set includes (SE17-SE40):

Twelve 50x50 foot tiles.
Twelve 50x100 foot tiles.
A map legend image detailing all map markup.
A one-third scale summary map showing all tiles.
A short readme PDF.




All maps are ready-to-use PNG-format files compatible with most virtual tabletops. Use them as-is, or combine them into larger maps using your favorite image processing software.

166484.name: Beneath the Full Moon
166484.description:
Publisher blurb:

Your spring break adventure went sour last night when something mauled your guide and stole your food. Can you make it back to civilization?

166485.name: Beneath a Metal Sky
166485.description:
Publisher blurb:

Your salvage crew came upon a derelict ship floating in space, docked, and began exploring. Now, your ship is gone, and you need to find a way out.

166486.name: Beneath the Mask
166486.description:
Publisher blurb:

It was supposed to be a relaxing weekend at your friend's cabin, and some psycho in a hockey mask attacked. Now two people are dead, and your host is a gibbering wreck. Can you make it through to morning?

166487.name: BOLD: The Book of Legends and Deeds
166487.description:
from the introduction

BOLD is the book of legends and deeds. With just a handful of dice rolls, BOLD can generate interesting character histories, downtime events, and even adventures. Any character instantly obtains deeds and legends that are overcome in unexpected ways. These deeds can even arc out in to entire stories.

Best of all BOLD is system and setting agnostic. It will work in mouseland fantasy just as well as pocket-dimension town or sci-fi detective stories.

166488.name: Ultimate Warriors Catalogue
166488.description:
From the back of the book:

"Every warrior needs weapons, and every warrior needs weapons. And what every warrior REALLY needs is the Ultimate Warriors Catalogue from Brile Fire-eyes!

Detailing everything held in stock, and including commentaries by our experienced and knowledgeable sales staff:

42 Different Armour Types;
17 Different Helmet Types;
22 Different Shield Types;
67 Different Weapon Types.

Illustrated in full colour and with full descriptions, this catalogue should be n the backpack of every warrior!

Brile Fire-eyes."

166489.name: Vikings: The Card Game
166489.description: In Vikings: The Card Game, 2-4 players compete to gain 'Renown' to win the game as the most famous Viking of their time. Players may earn 'renown' by exploring, raiding, and settling new lands. Players win the new lands by bidding the number of fleets they will commit to the adventure, then comparing strength totals of the fleets committed.

166500.name: Cookie Clicker
166500.description:
Cookie Clicker is a JavaScript-based browser video game written by French programmer Julien Thiennot, who is better known as "Orteil" (French pronunciation: ​[ɔʁtɛj], literally toe), and released on August 10, 2013. The point of the game is to bake cookies as fast as possible, to have a large number of cookies, and to have a lot of milk, which gives a clicking multiplier. However, there is no true end to the gameplay. To start the game, the player bakes cookies solely by clicking on a giant cookie, gaining one cookie each time it is clicked. With sufficient cookies to use as currency, a player can buy items and upgrades that will bake more cookies automatically, and increase the number of cookies per click.

At first, the player clicks on the cookie on the left side of the screen to earn cookies per click, initially at a rate of one cookie per click. With these cookies, the player can purchase items that automatically make cookies for them, such as grandmas, farms, and cursors; and the player may upgrade the number of cookies produced per click. The more cookies produced, the better items that are available for purchase. The player is progressively able to purchase better items and make cookies at a faster rate. New items and features are added with ongoing updates of the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cookie Clicker", available under the CC-BY-SA License.
